review_body: this was our 2nd time staying at Mercure Ginza. This time as gold Accor member. The high~light of our stay was still the location of the hotel. It was close to the train station, restaurants and shopping centers. We stayed for 3 nights, but never tried their breakfast. The room was upgraded from standard to 1 level above, not much of a big difference except for the pod coffee machine. The room was small and it was expected. The staffs were very kind and pleasant. Overall we had a good experience staining at Mercure Ginza.

Direct access to Tokyo subway (although a little bit difficult with luggage on stairs). Easy to navigate around Tokyo. Very friendly staff. Comfortable room - allowed early check after overnight flight from Australia

Was the first and great experience in Tokyo we are looking forward to come back next year, for I hope the same great experience we had this year. The welcome from the team was very good and we really feel at home during our time in Tokyo.

Bed was comfortable, loved having a bath tub. Easy walking distance to shops and restaurants. Got a complementary late checkout as an ALL silver member and a free drink. The Manager was very helpful with information on our train route booking to get to Hakuba. Very pleasant stay.

Small rooms , clean rooms , long corridors .... restaurant serves ok international dishes . Location is fabulous near the main Ginza corridor but in a quiet street, close to lots of restaurants for all budgets . I have stayed here several times .... and love the quiet neighborhood.

If hotel provide us the international outlet and razor, i will give room 5/5Staff are very friendly and polite Too little Japanese Breakfast but overall breakfast is goodWelcome drink is not separate between level

I stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and our 2.5-year-old son and the first thing that first comes to mind is that location is great if you are looking to stay in Ginza. It's only about a 10-minute taxi drive from/to Tokyo Station. When you go out of the hotel, there are many convenience stores nearby (some of them 24 hours) and McDonald's (24 hours as well) and Starbucks are literally only a 10-second walk from the hotel. So you can never be deprived of food. If you walk a few minutes, you'll see many upscale or branded stores in Ginza. Yurakucho station is also literally on B1 floor of the hotel. Ginza Station is also only a 5-minute walk. Very convenient location.Staff were professional, friendly, and welcoming.We booked a twin superior room and although it's not spacious (hotel rooms in general in Tokyo are small), it's relatively bigger than the rooms in comparable 3-star or 4-star hotels in Tokyo, especially in Ginza. The twin beds are also a bit wider. Nevertheless, the room was clean and there were complimentary bottled waters refilled everyday.Breakfast was also very good. It served Japanese food and international selections.Overall, it was an excellent stay and we definitely would like to come back here next time we visit Tokyo.

This hotel is what all other hotels should strive for. I left my glasses in the room after I checked out. I was so distraught that morning, my flight was cancelled by American Airline, my phone only has data. I went down to the lobby and told the helpful ladies by the front desk, they called AA for me but after 15 minutes, we knew that they were not going to pick up. I was so flustered that morning so I forgot my glasses. I didn't realize until I got to Narita Airport. I emailed them and they were just so helpful and let me know they found it. I flew back to the states when I got the email. I asked them to mail it back to me and I would pay the charges. The hotel staff wrapped my glasses so carefully in bubblewraps and then put it in a tin can so that it would get crushed during shipping.I mean, who gives this kind of customer service anymore? I am so touched and grateful that this hotel uphold their committment of service and ensure their guests are taken care of, even after check out.Thank you Mercure Ginza! This is an experience I will never forget.

The service from all staff is always of the highest standard - rooms are always very clean and well maintained - due to this I always return for my visits to Tokyo there is no requirement to look elsewhere

We recently had a great 4 night stay at this lovely little hotel.Everything went smoothly from the moment we made the reservation.We booked two rooms and emailed reservations and they allocated them side by side.Check in was seamless Mae who checked us in and looked after us on a daily basis with our breakfast vouchers, her service was absolutely fantastic. We are Gold Accor members and we were really grateful to have a very early check in from around 9:00am as we were straight off a very early morning flight.Breakfast was a really good mix and choice of Western and Asian cuisine and they did change certain dishes every day which kept it interesting. Also we got discount off our breakfast being Accor members which made it really economical.We had the privilege rooms and they were well laid out and really spacious by all standards, they also came with complimentary mini bar snacks, juice and soft drinks.This was handy for hungry teenagers after a long day walking around Tokyo.We were also given drink vouchers for a complimentary welcome drink in the bar.We were greeted by a such a nice young man Kenichi who was most attentive and helpful, and to our delight and surprise when we asked if they had champagne they offered us a complimentary glass of Mumm, which was absolutely lovely. This was such a lovely way to celebrate being in Tokyo!We were also lucky enough to meet the Hotel Manager Hiroshi Sasaki, who was charming and happy to help in anyway, and gave us lots of suggestions on what to eat and what to do when we were in Tokyo. We did discuss the hotel needing a restaurant for dinner and or lunch and Hiroshi said they are working on it, but for now the restaurant only serves breakfast (which is really good).This hotel is a real gem in Ginza, its so conveniently located, it is just a few minutes walk to the subway and it is close to lots of cute little inexpensive eateries. It is also in close walking distance to convenience stores, that sell everything from snacks to pre-made meals and even alcohol.We will certainly stay here again when in Tokyo!

It was a pure accident finding this hotel and it turned out to be an excellent choice. Very good location, close to Ginza subway station and not too far ( easy walking distance) from the imperial palace. Staff were all, without an exception, lovely, very friendly, polite and helpful. Room was a good size, large bed, large bathroom, complimentary tea, coffee and water, huge TV. Air conditioning not great, takes a while to get going. Breakfast was good, staff very polite and observant, offered to prepare different options for me (I never asked or complained about it) but they noticed I did not eat meat or fish. If you are looking for a place in Tokyo that is central, this is the place.

Hotel appears to be recently refurbished, rooms were great and location superb, only a block from the main Ginza shopping strip.. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to Tokyo.

Very well located one block from Matsuya department store smack in the middle of busy Ginza, but on a very quiet street. Rooms are smallish but comfy. There are no desks in the rooms, but you can ask for a folding desk if you need to work in your room. The restaurant is now only open for breakfast, not for lunch or dinner, but there are tons of restaurants in the area. I stay here every few months and the Mercure is generally the best value for money in the area.

Fabulous location above Ginza metro. Located on a quiet lane way and in the beautiful Ginza district of Tokyo. Lovely helpful staff that are multi lingual. Well appointed guest rooms, good size for Tokyo hotel rooms.

Another enjoyable stay in Ginza. The recent refurbishment is very tasteful. Hotel ambassadors very helpful especially Naki ? in the breakfast restaurant. Sorry there is no longer a dinner service, but understand the decision.

Mecure Ginza is a nice place to stay, with the shopping street just round the corner and the subway stations easy to get to. Greatly appreciate the front desk's extension for the late check out. It would be nice if the hotel staff noticed that it was a wedding anniversary trip after informing them via email weeks prior to stay. A little more welcoming, and well wishes would have perfect on the relationship building element. I must say that I have different expectations of the Accor Group's hotels, but it's cool, the stay has been completed and I would still return to Mercure Ginza for the value it offers. Thanks for another pleasant stay!

Being in Ginza I think the hotel is perfectly located for the Ginza Line and Yamanote Line that circles central Tokyo. Clean and Quiet and in the room High speed Wifi ( I thought my home wifi was fast ). Excellent service and I can not fault the hotel at all. Will have no problem stay there on my next trip.

All staffs in the front desk is very helpfull even i got wrong booking from accord marketing in indonesia.they help me and my family is so many ways to make us very comfortable. And all staff are very friendly...

Fantastic location, nice size clean rooms with a wardrobe and generally good service by staff. Good solid option for the price at this location. Appreciated the online check in option prior to arrival at the hotel.The bathroom was roomy and nice, good amount of counter space but horrible lighting for doing makeup. For whatever reason during my stay the hot water temperature stayed 'pleasant' at its maximum which was a bit of a shame.

The hotel is quite nice. The room was fairly large, especially given what I was expecting of Tokyo. The bathroom was spacious. The service at the hotel was great. The location near the Tokyo train station is helpful. The only problem I had was that when coming on foot from the station, the hotel is very easy to miss, the signage is not great.
user_name:
David L
New York City, New York

review_body: Upon checked in I asked to reception ms. Akie to helped me to book a transportation from Chitose airport to Hilton Niseko bcoz I tried for several times and asked concierge from Hilton osaka also, unfortunattely they could not helped me but Ms. Akie tried harder to found transportation for me until I got the bus. The day that I checked out, Ms. Imae was informed me with very friendly that our transportation was cofirmed and suggest us to keep our luggages until we check in again after 2days from Niseko. I went to breakfast and the food was so tasty and the staff very friendly . So happy to stay and will visit again to Mercure Ginza!

Great location situated in the middle of Ginza and in a quiet street. The rooms are recently refurbished, comfortable and very well soundproofed. Service is good. The restaurant area is in need of modernisation.

The location is perfect, near metro, a few mins walk to JR station. Many shops and food near by. The room is clean and staffs are friendly. We had a welcome drink from my member elite station, very relaxing bar and had a beer

My 3rd stay in this hotel was mainly based on it‘s great location in the city centre of Ginza and direct connection to the subway station. You find dozens of restaurants and shopping opportunities within walking distance.The room was spacious and the queen size bed comfortable. A small fridge was also available, and the shower performance better than average (high pressure and stable temperature).Nevertheless you should not book the optional breakfast buffet. It‘s lacking typical japanese food and is obviously focussed on western tourists only. The coffee machine provides not very tasty drinks and the taste of the offered food is average in the best case e.g. sausages, scrambled eggs and fruit salad are improvable for sure.Therefore I recommend this hotel for pure accommodation, you should go out for breakfast in one of the many cafes in the neighborhood.

I came with my wife but the size of the bed was too narrow that we can't sleep well, hope that the arrangement can be better next time with proper size of bed for a couple. Since when have vacation, sleeping is quite important to gain a good rest at night and have strength in the morning to have sight seeing, etc.

We arrived before noon due to our morning arrival from narita. We knew that the room was not available for check in due to the regulation and high seasson, just one day after xmas. So we decided heading to other places, and got back again at 1:30pm local time, and found out due to the membership status the room was upgraded, and still not ready and have to wait until 3pm.So we strolled around the neighborhood for some quick lunch, and back at the hotel at 3pm, and still not ready, and after had to wait until 4pm, without having clear communication, the receptionist offer us, if the booked room ( not upgraded one ) was available if i decided not to take the upgraded one, so pittyful that this kinda information would have not been informed earlier. So after waited nearly 4pm plus, we were given the priority room, which was kinda larger room that Tokyo standard, which we found kinda mend our dissapoinment after the long wait. Since its our family holiday, we try our best not to make a scene, here, just learn to acceept, cause the receptionist had kept appoligizing for the inconvinience and kindly enough to offer us a free breakfast voucher. Everything was in order and perfect, all the amenities, mini room bar were all compliments for us to have , since this was like the forth or fifth time for us at this hotel, due to our membership. During check out, we were given a holiday surprised again, which was additional charge due to the upgrade, that somebody forgot to inform us during check in apparently.We complain, and the nice lady who handled our check out was kind enough to waive this charge, due to the pre-information that was not delivered to us earlier. Due to the termination of my Accor plus membership, i dont know whether this hotel still have benefits for me, in my future tokyo trips .

I got my room upgraded but their toilet is not as expectation under Mercure and in Ginza area. My previous stay in 3 star hotel was much better than toilet quality of Mercure Ginza. There rest are good and exceed my expectation

This hotel is flawless from the staff in the reception who will greet and assist you with a smile and great customer service ready to answer and assist all queries.even in the restaurant all the staff are all smile to assist and ask if everyone is happy with the food in the buffet.The location was so perfect in the middle of Ginza Tokyo.Subway is just below the hotel.My only comment is the twin bed room is a bit small but understandable as per Tokyo’s standard this room is average and better already.The only cons is the pricing is a bit expensive since the hotel is only 3star.but overall the hotel is perfect and I will stay in this hotel again and again wenever I’m in Tokyo.

Stay in twin sharing for 3 nights 8-11 Dec. Location is proximity to shopping malls and tourists attractions. There is Direct express bus from Narita airport to Ginza bus station. Location is about 10 to 15 mins walk to tokyo train station.Room very clean. Not complaining on small room thou, cos that will be standard size for all hotel in japan.Will definitely stays there again if revisit Tokyo.

Location is really the key for this hotel. It’s accessible to many shops in Ginza. Itoya is just few steps from the hotel. Many convenience stores nearby. 7-eleven, Lawson, bakeries and MacDonalds (24 hour) were nearby. It’s also very near a metro station. Check in process was fast. The standard 3pm check in. We stayed for a week and the housekeeping service was good. The housekeeping staff would leave their names and notify us who cleaned the room. Bottles of mineral water were also topped up on daily basis. We did not get to try the breakfast as it was not part of what we booked. The only thing we thought that could be improved was probably bright lighting along the corridor. The facade of the hotel could also be easily missed as it looked like the back part of the hotel. Perhaps to have a bigger or more attractive sign.

Rooms are not vacuumed and cleaned properly. Dust seen along floor skirtings. Not to say under the bed, it is very visible and thick, not cleaned at all. Other mercure branches or Japan hotel also provided air purifier, not mercure Ginza though.

Good location. Helpful staff. downstairs the hotel there's a McDonalds and 7-11 if need to grab some stuff. 10 mins walk to Tokyo station. only thing for the price we should have been given the room with breakfast.

At reception a very warm welcome from the staff „hit“ me.Check in was done speditive and in shortest time.I‘ve got a nice upgrade to a spacious room.The Hotel is clean and well maintained, the staff friendly and helpful.Location of the Hotel is great. Shopping is in walking distance as well as the Palace.

Stayed with family (3 of us) over Thanksgiving weekend, for 4 nights. Hotel is in good location in the Ginza district, only about 3 blocks from the main shopping area. It carries a higher per night cost because of the location. The staff was friendly and helpful, and speak a number of languages (including fluent English). The room was clean and made up daily. Best for us: There is an underground train entrance at the basement of this hotel and taking this, with one other transfer, gets you to Disneyland. Also, they graciously held our bags for us on our check out day for 6 hours without charge so we could spend our last morning and afternoon free. There is a McDonalds in the same block (open 24 hours and good for coffee or quick breakfast) and Lawson's store a half block away for sundries. A number of restaurants are within easy walking distance. Underground trains on the Ginza line are also within walking distance.

It might just be that I was unlucky, and it has been a mixed and inconsistent experience with Mercure.The experience for the first two days were unsatisfactory. Staff at front desk looked very aggitated and ingenue when informing us the unavailability of a room upgrade, very big serivce quality gap between the receptionlists with its peers from other Accor hotel we stayed during the same trip.In addition, for the first day, used glasses not washed, toilet bowl was not cleaned completely. I used an insurance card instead of the hotel room card to turn on the power, but the card was removed and disappeared without notifying me.Extremely unfriendly car parking, the car park said my car is more than 1.55 m height so I cannot park there. The front desk said we can park at Kabukiza theater instead but the car park said they have closed down for maintenance. I circled round and round at mid night to find a car park. Horroble experience.Breakfast:Breakfast place looks good, but the procedure of buying a breakfast voucher first at hotel reception instead of directly charging/billing at the restaurant is somewhat the first time I experienced and it is awkward and inconvenient for hotel guests. There are limited varieties of food but with touches from basic Japanese rice and soup, to hams/bacons/sausage/breads, some fried noodles, fruit and salad bar, some cereals, coffee and tea, which is in general commensurating with the price. I personally think the hotel should get a restaurant for lunch and dinner, however I do realize there are many restaurants (a ramen stall, a McDonald, a Starbucks reserve, many Japnese restaurants, one Italian restaurant) and two convenience stores (offer microwave heated food 24 hrs) nearby within 1 to 2 mins work.The welcome drink was non-alcohol at the bar which was pretty basic.The check out experience was satisfactory and the staff were helpful in the late check out request.

Basically room is cleaned and location is good . But apparently, there is an european restaurant manager which offered very bad manners and attitude. My wife and myself were given welcome drink not knowing the restaurant is closed when we arrived at 4.00pm. This man came out unhappily told us off "Please go out". Is this the way to tell your hotel guest off? Please avoid this restaurant otherwise you will meet the same bad attitude treatment from this man.

Welcome was warm but our "Complimentary" room bar consisted of a bottle of water... complimentary to all guests! The beds were very hard as were the pillows (suit some folk, I guess!) and the room was quite pokey. Evening meals not provided but breakfast was extensive and generous.

The hotel is at a prime location in Tokyo. Easy access to transportation and a team of dedicated employees who are multilingual. The hotel is clean. The room is however small and you may need to bring less luggage if you want to stay there. The bathroom configuration is a bit odd and is probably not handicap accessible, hence not suitable for elderly. The experience above only pertains to my room. Hopefully, they might have other better room. The room I stayed was so small that I do not have room to put my laptop on to work. So, you might need an upgrade if you are on a business trip and need a station to do work.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights. You can walk around to many places: subway, shopping malls, Tokyo station, Royal palace etc. Especially at night the neighborhood lights up to a different world! Compare to many other hotels, the room size here actually is quite decent because in general hotel rooms are rather small in Tokyo. Front desk staff are always friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place

Stayed for 6 nights and by the third night I was getting claustrophobic. Only a narrow lane to walk between the bed, TV and wall. One chair stuffed between the window, lamp and bed..No where to put the suitcases if you don't want to completely unpack them. There is a large step up into the bathroom, which can be a bit dangerous especially at night. Breakfast was good. Many options for Asian food, but the toast and croissants don't change. To be a bit picky they were missing fish, cheese and meats other than bacon and sausage. The waiters were hovering all around and it felt a bit intrusive. The reception staff did speak English and could give directions or make reservations as needed.

Highly professional and helpful staff, especially staff at breakfast who are super efficient, friendly and keen to assist. Stayed 6 nights, very quiet but close to both glitzy shops and super food malls in the basements of both large department stores only minutes from the hotel. A short walk to Ginza station, slightly longer to Tokyo so it makes much of Tokyo very accessible, once you navigate the station’s labyrynth! Also only minutes from 7/11 ATM facility.

Excellent location, professional staff. Room size is very good but it could be better if done by occupancy!In any case overall hospitality was excellent.My sincere thanks Miri, Aiya, Shoko, Tanc and Yuki!  Arigatogozaimasu!

Book a standard room, was upgraded and inclusive of breakfast for my accor status.Location, next to subway and a short walk to all the ginza mall n eatery.I was impress with the check in, fast and detailed. The reception area, though is small, its efficient and has a very modern look. I like it.Room was well furnish and deco very modern. Consider respectable size in Tokyo.Service was great. Love it.

We are so pleased we booked this hotel. The location was perfect, a short walk to Ginza station and not too far fromTokyo station. There is also a station underneath the hotel which can be accessed directly via the hotel lift. The best thing for us was that is was so easy to get to/from Narita airport as there is a ¥1,000 shuttle bus which was so efficient and takes you to/from Ginza station straight to/from your terminal). The room is small but there was enough room for a large and small suitcase. The bathroom is pretty basic and I wasn’t too impressed with the shower (I’m particularly not a fan of the shower curtain). It was also annoying that there are no power points next to the bed. These small things aside, we would definitely stay again.

Check in was efficient and friendly.The room is quite small but well appointed. Good bathroom with great toilet (seat warmer, bidet and shower).The room on the 9th floor (no view) was very quiet. The Tv had only a few stations with only BBC in English.

Tokyo is big and very spread out so you need to choose your hotel caefully.The Mercure is 2 blocks from Ginza shops, 10 minutes walk from Tokyo Station and has access to the subway from its basement. You are surrounded by a huge range of shops, bars and restaurants all within walking distance.Hotel staff are friendly and professional and speak good English. They can advise on restaurants and nearby attractions.The rooms are not large but are well designed and contain all you need including a safe and bar fridge. They are extremely quiet. Breakfast is a buffet, hot and cold, and quite There is a cocktail bar open in the evening.I would certainly stay here again.

Very good and stylish hotel in an upmarket part of Tokyo. Very convenient for local metro stations and an easy 10 / 15 minute walk from the main Tokyo station. Checkin as easy and the staff were friendly and professional. Breakfast was ok - some Japanese and some western foods but not really one thing for the other. The only disappointment would be the size of the bed. Fortunately I was staying here on my own and the room was advertised for two people but there's no way both myself and my wife could have fitted in the bed let alone sleep in it. If it wasn't for that I'd have given 5 stars.

Brilliantly located compact hotel just two streets away from the main Ginza Dori, and Ginza Metro station. For a big variety of inexpensive eateries head towards Yurakucho which is only six minutes walk away.Decor is slightly quirky French contemporary. Rooms are compact but all Tokyo hotels are unless you are paying megabucks. Beds are firm, which I like, and we heard no-one - so a good nights sleep. The bathroom has a small bath with a dated shower but all works fine. My only suggestion would be that the shower curtains are changed more often.Amenities are good bearing in mind this is not 5star and the staff are exceptionally helpful and polite and many of them speak excellent English. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return.

We Booked This Hotel as we were AccorHotels Members. The Room Rate was expensive but we in The Ginza. Checking in was slow and a bit disappointed. We arrived on time for check in but had wait 30 minutes. Great Room and Very Comfortable. Drinks are expensive but best to drink outside the hotel . We will Return.

Modern hotel in Ginza, modern central district of Tokio. The staff is very nice, breakfast=plenty of choice, both european and asian food. Nearby you can find shinkansen and also metro station and lot of shops.

The hotel is located right in the center of Ginza very convenience to travel around Tokyo. There is the under ground station entrance connect to the hotel that make life so easy. The breakfast is good the quality of food and service is fantastic but should have more selection.

This hotel is located above the Ginza-itchome metro station (Exit 11) which services the Yurakucho line which was handy. It is also a short walk to Ginza line metro stations, and the Yurakucho and Tokyo JR Stations which are on the Yamanote line. The room was recently renovated, modern and a good size by Tokyo standards. I was however pretty disappointed with the bathroom facilities which are very dated and in need of a refresh. At $350 AUD a night I wasn't expecting to be using a shower over bath, complete with shower curtain! Staff were friendly and spoke good English. As an Accor member we were given late check out to 3pm which was great as we had a very late flight out of Tokyo.

Nice little cosy Mercure in th éventer of Ginza. Excellent location, nice staff, willing to help.Rooms are smaller than in other Mercure hotels but probably due to the country lack of space.Breakfast was ok. Mostly international, only limited Japanese options.

Amazing hotel and a lovely place to stay. Staff are very welcoming and very friendly and helpful. Japan is a wonderful country and the people are very friendly and helpful. Hotel was in a great location. Thank you for an amazing stay.

The hotel is very clean and the staff very welcoming. The location is ideal for exploring Ginza and is just a short walk from multiple subway stations. The wine selection is good and I enjoyed several after hour drinks at the bar. The restaurant is only open for breakfast, but there are many dining options nearby.

I was told the hotel has descent size rooms however I had to change my room 2 times because both the times I got Pillars/column in the room. First, the size of the room was small on top it blacked. Finally, the staff managed to assign another acceptable room. As a vegetarian I did not find any hot breakfast for me. It was breads and beverages. Staff overall is cooperative and the Place is in the center of the Ginza so accessibility is easy

We were staying at this place when the typhoon began in Tokyo. Due to the weather our cruise was delayed for two days, there were no trains or subway or anything! Everything was closed!. After staying two nights and asking for a couple of more nights the staff at the hotel had the rooms available but said I had to do it through their page, I had no wifi available.Mr Tanaka the guest service official couldn't or wouldn't do anything to help in an emergency. We had to loose our money (no refunds!)for the night and flee Tokyo to any destination far from the typhoon and spend the two nights elsewhere and had to pay twice for the nights.On then understanding that it was an emergency situation I expected more sympathy and helpfulness on their part, which I never got.

Ideal location in the heart of Ginza. Walk to shopping, restaurants and trains. Staff are amazing and will look after you from check in, very friendly and warm.After travelling for three weeks, enjoyed here for a few days.

Needed a hotel near everything in Ginza. Loved it. Beautiful! Modern! Ecclectic! The decorations have me at home resigning with what I saw. The Bathroom all white and beautiful. You'll not be disappointed!!

Comfort, cozy, modern cobcept hotel in the heart of Ginza shopping, fashionista area. The room space are wider than average hotel room in Tokyo.equipped with all facilities automatic toilet bowl, hair dryer, plenty of power outlets and charging USB ports, Flat screened TV, complimentary drinks, 2 bottle of drining water, electroc kettle, safebox ,the hotel provides wide 5 feet soft mattress for deep sleep with serenity . Its window open to street of Ginza1 lane, a bit short walk to the main Ginza street lining with brandname flagshipstores and other retailers.

Rooms were a good size for Tokyo.They had a 15th birthday celebration and we were all invited to the bar downstairs for freeflowing Mumm champagne, nibbles and a roving violinist. A wonderful night. The night before they had the rugby world cup playing so it was great to able to watch the games and socialise.

Great location. The subway line is at the basement of the hotel are all linked. Staff are friendly ,helpful and warm-heart. The will take the initiative to know your flight time and ask if you need late check out. We also received a welcome gift. The room is small but clean and tidy.

Positives- Great location close to numerous JR and subway lines making it easy to navigate Tokyo. Really can't fault it.- Great if you want to get away from the craziness of other suburbs like Shinjuku at the end of the day.- Surrounded by plenty of shops, bars and restaurants all of which we visited were excellent.- Friendly check in staff who provided sound advice, recommendations and suggestions.- Room clean and recently renovated, I would imagine.- Great shower with good water pressure.- Check out straightforward.Why not 5 stars?Negatives- Room is small. Booked a superior room but looked more like the photos for the standard room, with one side of the bed up against the wall.- Lack of storage, so didn't really un-pack whilst we were thre for five days.- Not sure why there was a huge sofa that took up half the room, when it would have been better use of space to move the bed and have two bed-side tables instead).- Dark room with no view as it faced an office wall, which I guess is common in many city hotels.The real big negative was the Bar Manager.A few have commented in previous posts about his unfortunate manner.As an Accor member you are given a free drink voucher. On returning to the hotel on our first night, we decided to go to the bar to use it. He sighed and gave the impression that we were preventing him from closing the bar early - as everyone we had met in Japan had been so friendly, this surly Frenchman was a bit of a disappointment!We did not visit the bar again, as I did not want to encounter this man, who in my opinion was patronising and rude. I did tell him so as well. This was a shame as all other staff were so lovely and helpful.

We were in Japan for 2 weeks and was checking in and out of Mercure Ginza to leave our luggages when we go for short trips outside of Tokyo. By the time we came back to Tokyo, everyone in the hotel front desk knows us already. They became very friendly and would joke with us as well. The only reason why I didn’t give full star rating was because we were not upgraded despite the Long stay in Tokyo for 1 week. We somehow managed with 4 big luggages in the room though. The location of the hotel is great and during weekends the Main Street our from hotel is closed to traffic which makes it great for shopping! The subway exits are all linked and if you are going Disney, the subway line is at the basement of the hotel! How perfect!

The location is closely located to multiple subway stations, food and shopping options all within walking distance. The room is small but there is space to open up the luggage for packing. Overall the room that I was allocated came with a relatively spacious bathroom, and is kept clean and tidy all the time.

I really enjoyed the high class service. The way the staff communicated and worked wih us was excellent. The rooms were always clean and neat. We also enjoyed the diversity of foods during breakfast and the personnel in the restaurant was always helpful and warm-hearted.

We stayed here for 5 nights Sept 13-17 and were very pleased. Prior to booking we read some negative reviews but we decided to book based on location. We booked a larger room based on the sizes listed on the website and found more than enough room to unpack and relax after our daily sight seeing marathons. Why would anyone reserve a small room and then complain when the information is clearly provided on the website? Every evening we retuned to a clean room with restocked toiletries and fresh towels if we requested. The AC was always working well in our room and I am usually too warm so this was perfect. The hallways were warm in the morning but since this accounted for 2-3 minutes of each day it was a non issue. Maybe the negative reviewers were sleeping in the hallway? The breakfast room was bright with a selection for a traditional breakfast like eggs, bacon, yogurt, bread, jam, pastries, as well as some Asian style choices such as dumplings, noodles, fish with some daily changes. Overall this was an excellent hotel stay.

We just stayed at the Mercure Tokyo Ginza on our arrival to Japan. Some of the reviews on TripAdvisor had me a little worried, but the hotel is great. It is clean, quiet and the Ginza location is awesome for getting food, shopping and convenience. The restaurant choices in the area are great, the best stores are right next door, and subway access super close to Ginza line. The breakfast is complete with western style or Japanese options and is good and very fresh. Everything in the room functioned perfectly, the AC is awesome. The toilet from North American standards was like an enigma in and of itself. We have a bidet at home, but this thing had a mind of it’s own. You never had to touch it! Our room was very nice, plenty of room. I know some have said the room is small, but you have options to choose from. I consider myself to be a picky person, I really enjoyed the hotel!

Overall service is good. Breakfast spread is good. Room is rather compact and small but clean. The TV location is not suitable as viewing is difficult when sitting on the chair.Location of the hotel is excellent.

When my wife and I checked in I thought that there may have been a little more attention and assistance provided rather than just the courteous but basic check in procedure. I recently enrolled as a LeClub Accor member but was not acknowledged as a member. Should I have been? I don't know. But more importantly my wife was on crutches, and in fact the hotel had prior knowledge of my wife's condition. I had brought up our 2 suitcases and 1 overnight bag up the lift on my own. I didn't mind that but I would have thought that the staff would have rendered immediate assistance with the bags, instead I had to ask for the bags to be taken to our room. I also expected that given my wife's condition we could have been provided with advice on access to nearest transport, subway stations and exits.The room itself was clean and stocked with the appropriate amenities.The room was a queen superior but was quite smallish and with very little room for luggage. the hotel faces an office building so there are no views to speak of, even at higher floors.The buffet breakfast didn't have a large variety of food but was adequate in terms of quality. The restaurant staff were quite friendly.The biggest plus about the hotel is its proximity to the heart of Ginza.

If you’re a reader of my reviews you’ll know my opinion of mercure are pretty low and I personally rank them as the poorest Accor group chain but with limited Accor group options in good locations in Tokyo I booked (thankfully at a good offer rate including breakfast) with low expectations.How wrong I was! Wonderful warm, helpful and competent staff, immaculate room, quirky decor (as you kind of expect in Tokyo) and superb in room facilities (tea & coffee, water in a fridge, dressing gowns and slippers). The only slight let down is the cramped and old-fashioned bathroom which appears to be a pod type that I suspect has little potential to redecorate without ripping the whole thing out, however it was immaculately clean with more than necessary toiletries provided.Breakfast was very good with a great choice both hot and cold of both oriental and western-friendly dishes.Overall an excellent hotel I would happily consider again to stay in Tokyo and highly recommend.

Equipped with McD.. it's very helpfull for people who just landed.. grab McD to rescue your stomach and recharge.. not sure 24 Hours or not but useful.The Room is very small for Mercure standart yet understandable for Tokyo context

My husband and I checked-in yesterday, it was a pleasant checked-in. We called the front desk in the evening telling them the aircon is not really working and warm. We were told to wait for a while as it will take time to get cold. We waited for an hour there was no improvement. So we called again and we were told they can’t do anything, all the rooms are like that!? The staff told us that they have a fan, we waited for the fan to be sent BUT No one showed up till we called again. The staff said there is no fan!!! And a staff showed up to tell us there is no fan, nothing can be done. The staff suggested for us to change room at passed midnight! This is ridiculous! This is so contradicting when we were told earlier that all rooms are the same temperature!!!!!In addition to the AIRCON problem, the room is only semi renovated. The toilet is not renovated and not clean! My husband and I stay in this hotel on a yearly basis for the last 4 years. Service is never excellent, is only acceptable. But this time is the ultimate worst experience in this hotel!

I did not realise the hotel did not have a restaurant. I think this is a massive negative. I would not have booked there if I had known and people I spoke to said the same. Other wise a nice hotel in a godd location.

Very standard hotel. Key is the great location, right in the middle of Ginza. Makes it super easy to go from the 5th Avenue of Tokyo to plenty of other neighbourhoods in the city. Small rooms, but very comfy. Very friendly staff. Decent breakfast, although I was expecting a bit more there. Two things I would change to rate this place excellent : 1. There is no AC in the lift and hallway, which transform themselves in oven in the summer heat. 2. The hotel has a bistro but it is closed for lunch and it was closed as well when I arrived at 2100. That should change.

We had a pre-paid reservation and arrived over an hour past the stated check-in time. We were disappointed to arrive (jet lagged) and be told that they didn't have a room for us. We had two wait in their crowded, noisy lobby. Like a lot of hotels in Japan, our room was small which was expected. The furniture pictured on their website was accurate but our room did not match the one pictured. The furniture was crammed into a smaller space. We felt that the photos were misleading, at least for our room. Another thing about the room that was a challenge was that there was just no room to unpack. That's fine if you are staying one night but if you have a multi-night stay you want to unpack. I would gladly give up the refrigerator for some shelving for clothes.

Not sure what the housekeeping did but my handbag was on the floor when I came back to my room, the footrest was placed away from the chair, seems like they didn't change the towels (it was damp and was not folded nicely).The walls are very thin so you can hear your neighbours/noises from the hall. Other than that, the front desk staff are friendly and helpful.

My previous trip to Mercure was a very good one. I was given complimentary upgrading to a nice huge room with everything I need from expresso machine to huge variety of spa quality toilet amenitiesI guess they must have change manager. I use my Accor free nite to book for single person room. For no rhyme or reason, they put me in a twin room and upon check out, I was ask to pay 2000 yen !!!! They insist I ask for twin room but I was staying alone. I check in as late as 9pm and check out at 6.30 am because I had book a trip to mount Fuji. I do not have time to argue otherwise I will miss my tour. I ask for the manager but he was in hiding and the poor girl at the reception had to deal with the matter. Out of frustration and sympathy for the girl, I paid for it. I think Mercure should investigate this irresponsible manager and refund me this moneyOtherwise the room is huge and nicely renovated. Good location. But at the end hospitality is about the human touch, the empathy that guest often are in a hurry and not take advantage of this to spring additional charges on them.

Hotel has a great location and the staff is super! Both the front desk and the bar, great time. However, they save money by not letting you lower the AC too much. My room was at best fresh and not cold. Sweated at night every night, very uncomfortable.

A Cool little hotel is the Mercure Ginza. Situated in an excellent location, just steps from the vibrant Ginza, with compact rooms with bathtubs, modern fitouts & comfortable beds, the Mercure maybe considered a reasonable accommodation choice.The staff are all lovely & helpful. There is no restaurant onsite for lunch or dinner. There is a breakfast room with a very average buffet breakfast offered. There is also a lack-luster early evening bar (the bar man there is not quite as friendly or helpful as the reception staff...he come across as somewhat cold & pompous infact ). But, there are plenty of other options nearby for excellent & varied 'wining & dining' so the shortcomings of the Mercure, in this respect, may be easily overcome. My stay here @ present is very disappointing as the room is NOT clean. Black hair strands throughout the room & bathroom, a really smelly shower curtain (the mouldy smell permeates out into the whole room), dust and hair settled in the grate alongside the bathtub and a used toothbrush & other discarded items left up on the wardrobe ledge...yuck. Very disappointing for an ACCOR hotel to offer such a substandard level of cleanliness.

The hotel was very comfortable and the room was spacious and clean. The hotel is well located near the hustle and bustle of Ginza and near various metro lines. Breakfast had a vast selection to suit all. Highly recommend this hotel

Very convenient location, with one metro line in the basement of the hotel and another a 5 minute walk away. Many restaurants within a 5-minute walk.Fantastic coffee in the breakfast buffet..... and the food was pretty good too.Very helpful reception staff who answered many questions and in good English.

Convenient location just off the main street of the Ginza. Yurakucho Station (the stop before Tokyo) was a few blocks away. It would probably take about 20 minutes to walk to Tokyo Station with a case. There was access to the subway via the hotel although with stairs if you have a case. I liked the alcove with the wardrobe where I could put my case out of the way. Well appointed bathroom. Excellent breakfast with plenty of choice both European, Japanese and Chinese.

I stayed her for 3 nights. Location was very central and fantastic, next to a subway stop. Not difficult considering in Tokyo there is a subway stop on practically every corner.The staff at the hotel were fantastic and provided an amazing service. Was able to check in early 9with a fee), but it felt good to have a shower and a sleep upon arrival and not have to wait until afternoon check in.The staff at the bar was also super friendly and accommodating....especially the one that helped me find the restaurant I had walked by the night before where I really wanted to eat. She was amazing.I would not hesitate to stay here again. I absolutely loved Tokyo!

I prepaid for the room when booked but when we arrived at 4:00 pm, the room was still not ready! More strange was the insistence of the front desk clerk to "CHECK" on my credit card to make sure it's "WORKING" although the room charge for 3-night stay was already paid in full and deducted from my account.

Located about a twenty minute walk from the central railway station this hotel is hotel is situated amongst all the famous designer label shops. The hotel staff were friendly and courteous although language was a problem.Rooms in keeping with Japanese standards were small but comfortable, clean and well appointed. Beds were exceptionally comfortable. The dinning room offered a great selection of international dishes.To assist travellers, the hotel should include their address in Japanese as well as in English on booking confirmations. It is surprising, arriving in the early hours without a local SIM card to assist with mapping and translation the number of taxi drivers refusing a fare because they did not know where to go.

Good hotel in a great location. Easily accessible to the main Ginza area with lots of shops and places to eat. Hotel rooms were small but clean and well kept. Staff were very helpful and polite. Recommended for stay

They sold me a room for 3 people, with just one bed. no sofa or extra small bed available. Prepaid. When I complaint the only answer was “it is what it is”. Very disappointing. Never Mercure again. No book for formal complaints available either.

Not my first visit to Tokyo, but my first time staying at Mercure Tokyo Ginza. Mercure Tokyo Ginza is in the heart of the bustling Ginza area surrounded by malls, and eateries. It is extremely convenient with short walks to the main train stations to move around Tokyo. Staff were extremely friendly and attentive.It is definitely on my list of first considerations on my next visit to Tokyo.

A very well situated hotel close to number of metro stations within easy walking distance. Same applies to eating out. All the hotel staff were very helpful and check in and out was quick and easy. Our room was small but totally adequate. It was well worth adding breakfast when booking your stay, good wholesome food. We would certainly stop here again.

Terrible experience during check-in, no upgrade room for accor gold member, no extra bottle of water. Very small room...decent breakfast, near office building, very crowded. Not many option food, no view outside room/window, just office building...

I spent two nights with my wife at the hotel couple weels ago for a short trip to Tokyo. I think it is a 3-star hotel with 4 star services. The hotel is not grand, but it is comfortable. The room is cozy and comfortable for two persons. The bathroom is relatively large compared with some similar grade hotel in Tokyo. The room is clean too. What is more is that the reception is very helpful and friendly. We arrived in Tokyo very early (around 7am) in the morning and we reached the hotel about 10:30am. The reception could offer us a room right away at an additional charge which is considered very reasonable (the price, the hourly rate, is even more attractive than those capsule hotels in Tokyo). But we did not take the offer as we decided to head to the town right away. Still the room is available for us at 2pm which is better than many hotels which I had stayed before. Mercurer is in a convenient location - you can access to the Ginza-itchome or Gina Metro Stations within 5 minutes walk. And within the same walk distance is the main street of Ginza where there are departmen stores and boutiques. I'd like to thank the hote staff for making a comfortable stay for us.

We spend 2 nights at the Mercure Tokyo Ginza. Upon arrival we were welcomed, in the most pleasant manner, by the team at the reception. Which, given we just spend 15 hours traveling, says a lot about the Mercure team. We booked a privilege room, which was tastefully decorated. The room size was fine for a family of 3 and the beds we found to be really good! As already mentioned by other reviewers, the location is perfect to explore Ginza area and as abase for the rest of Tokyo.We will be back at the end of this month for another 3 days and are looking forward to it.

comfort bed, helpfull staff speak english, especially with direction to interest places, near shopping center, near many good restaurant and cafe, recomended for first time travelling to Tokyo. Definitely go back again to this hotel.

If you like staying in Ginza, the Mercure has an easy location. The all place looks like it's been recently renovated. I found it quiet but the room was very very small ; it's been OK for a very short stay but I wouldn't like to stay more than two or three nights. The most problematic is that there was no desk (it's not possible to work on the very small table there), so I would not recommend the hotel for a business trip.I didn't try the breakfast nor any food so I have no idea of how it is. Staff at the reception was very nice, helpful and enthusiast.

Located a 15 min walk from Tokyo Station we really enjoyed our stay here. Ginza itself is full of places to eat & there are plenty of transport options too.We were 3 adults in a room & found it comfortable in size. The room was very clean & maintained that way throughout our stay. We had plenty of towels & amenities in the bathroom for all of us all of a good standard product. The staff are beautiful, exceptionally friendly & helpful. We needed to borrow umbrellas during our stay & the reception girl was so upset one of them was a bit broken. We didn't mind at all but her reaction was very sweet. This was our first time in Japan & it was all very daunting, with Mercure Ginza as our base we felt very safe & well taken care of.

It is typical city hotel in Tokyo. Small rooms but the location in the middle of Ginza ward. The hotel is surrounded by 3 convenient stores and the great thing is the hotel basement is connected to Ginza-Itchome metro station. The staff is so friendly and speak fluent english. They even help me to get an emergency courier to send my luggage from this hotel to a hotel in Hakone just a couple hours! Thanks for the help.

Amazing little hotel... for which the room is bigger than usual 3 Star Hotel in Tokyo... the lack of pool or gym probably that bumps this hotel from 4 to 3 Stars Hotel. But the service from check in to check out to helping get a taxi during rush hour... superb!!!! The Subway on the basement of hotel don’t really get you familiar places... not sure where the route goes!! But the Ginza Sanchome Station is like 400m away. There’s Natural Lawson (healthier convenient store) and McD like 3 minutes walk away. Overall pleasant stay at a superb hotel. Recommended!!!

Clean and comfortable. Friendly staff, right on a metro and close to good shops. Breakfast was a good selection albeit in a small dining room. Fast internet, if that’s important to you. Very good price for the heart of Tokyo. Overall, a pleasant hotel to stay.

The hotel is in excellent location, close to Tokyo station, to the touristic areas (Emperors garden) as well as to vibrant streets with lots of restaurants and shops.In addition to the the hotel staff was extremely helpful, when asking for a writings desk they have provided me one in the room.It was very positive, next time in Tokyo I will go back there for sure!

Visiting Tokyo, we choosed to stay at Mercure Ginza and we really recommend it.Ginza is a very convenient area to use as base for visiting Tokyo. It's well connected, close to Tokyo main station, and with plenty of nice places to eat.We really enjoyed Mercure Hotel. Rooms are not big (but that's very common in Tokyo) but very comfortable. Our room was always perfectly clean, and very quiet. Bed was comfy too.Hotel staff was extremely kind and helped us anytime we needed.Good breakfast, with many choices either for Asian or western food.If we are be back in Tokyo we'll staying at this hotel.

The hotel is centrally located in the heart of the shopping area and the poshest area.Also within walking distance from Tokyo Main Station which provides convenient connections by Shinkansen Bullet train all over Japan. The rooms are medium sized. It is a small hotel but with good service. Dining and shopping ares are nearby. Also good nightlife.

Great Location, near Ginza station and shopping district. Comfortable room, even the space is a little bit small, but still nice. I like how they put artistic touch in the interior detail. Recommended to stay .

This a quaint, boutique-style hotel, a short walk from the famous Ginza strip and Mitsukoshi Department store. The rooms were tiny but very clean and comfortable, that is, if you don’t plan on bringing large suitcases. We upgraded to the “larger” Privilege Room with two single beds, and this was a better fit for us. The breakfast buffet was adequate, but could do with some daily changes, as they served us, the same exact fare every day. What made this hotel shine was the fantastic service of the hotel’s staff, most especially the ladies behind the front desk. They made sure we were comfortable and met our needs, even calling for certain places we had to go to, without complaint and always with a smile. One of the best hotels that I’ve been to, that made us feel welcome and at home. I would highly recommend this hotel.

My hubby and I stayed here for a week and we both enjoyed our stay. The local staff was very friendly and helpful. Thanks for the welcome gift and drinks. Nice rooms, good amenities and clean just a little small. It's 7-10 mins walk to Ginza main line and our fav McDonald, Lawson, Starbucks just 1-2 min away and many nice restaurants nearby as well. It's very safe to walk even at night. We will definitely stay again for our next trip.

The Mercure allowed an early check in at about 1pm which got things off to a nice start. The room size slightly larger than Tokyo standards, meant we could settle in comfortably. It proved the perfect base to shoot off to both Shibuya and Asakusa on the metro. The breakfast spread was adequate, nothing more, and the bartender who took my free drink voucher on the first night of my stay, made me feel like it was coming out of his pocket, but aside from this we loved our stay and would come back again.

I have now stayed at this hotel on several occasions whilst visiting Tokyo both business and pleasure - staff are always extremely helpful / service is A1 and with recent upgrade of rooms there is no better place to stay in Ginza - I look forward to my next visit in August

The location is superb and everything is within a stone throw away. Direct train from Haneda airport and just 2 mins walk from the Higashi Ginza station. Room is quite spacious, bigger than the average hotels in the city. Friendly and helpful staff. Will stay again for my next visit.

Great stay in frenetic Ginza. Rooms were quiet, staff friendly and professional - what more could you ask for? Would highly recommend for those wanting to experience Tokyo for the first time. Looking forward to coming back.

Love the location, walk 1.5 blocks and you are in the heart of Ginza shopping districts. You can reach a subway line from their basement level. Their breakfast buffet is also quite good. But the best thing they offer is free phone called “handy”, you can call home, you can walk around using Google map with it and it’s free! What a plus!

Wow, what a nice and fancy Hotel! We arrived after a japan cruise in that Ginza hotel. This is located in the heart of Tokio, called Ginza, where you have nice shopping street "Ginza" and all luxury shops literally around the corner. it is easy to get to Ginza hotel which is subway station Ginza and has got underground metro access. when we arrived at the reception desk we could feel the entire friendliness of Japan. You feel like a prince, they treat you super nicely and politely. We got an upgrade into a bigger room which has got all amenities for free. the room was very nice, modern colours and it felt like you are in your own living room. the bed had feather/goose blanket and cousins and we slept like babies. very quite room indeed. from that location you reach all attractions by metro. the train, metrosystem works perfectly well and you are cheaper and faster by metro than by taxi!Exec summary:- top service- top location- top roomsA place you must book.Best regardsPeter S. Philipp

We have got good services from hotel staff and room quality are good. Front staff do help us for any requests with willing and kindness. But Hotel Breakfast room are very small. Breakfast food are also good and delicious but Hotel Breakfast room are very small.

The hotel was close to the city center, with a train station located below it for easy access. It was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only slightly off putting thing was the French bar tender who was not very talkative and a bit gruff, but there was a small bar just down the street which was handy.

Comfortable stay with spacious ensuite bathroom. Nice interior design after renovation. Helpful staff, english and multilingual speaking. Very convenient with superb location, easy access to subway station directly from the hotel. Perfect for business and leisure trip. Shops, restaurants, cafes, convenient stores, department stores, 24 hrs mcdonald and public transportation are all around and in walking distance. Indoor parking available at the building where the hotel is loacted with special overnight discount rate for hotel guest. Can not fault of any service at time of our stay. However, lobby is on 2nd floor which may affect a little bit of inconvenience if you need any immediate assistance. More impressive than expected. Inter-connecting rooms available. Complimentary 2 bottles of water daily. 'Handy' phone provided and very useful.

Stayed here for a night as part of the transit out of Tokyo.Arrival early but as part of Gold Member of Accor was allowed checked in. As usual the free welcome drink and souvenir was a nice token appreciated.Rooms are small but that's normal in this part of town. Though they still manage to squeeze in a bath tub in toilet somehow. All amenities included in the room in case u forgot ur toothbrush.Walking distance to a few metros and right smack in the heart of Ginza which is convenient for travellers.The entrance of the hotel is not exactly at the lobby level so you will first need to take a lift up. Do take note but fortunately signs are clear so should. Not be an issue.

We stayed here for 6 nights. Location couldn’t be better-2blocks off the main Ginza street and many restaurants/fast food places in the area. The subway is right next door and the access is also through the hotel. The front desk personnel are exceptionally helpful and personable. The only complaint I have is that the breakfast-which is not included in the room rate-is very sparse especially re fresh fruit. Also the rooms are small as v the Tokyo Hilton on the other side of town.

stayed here for 6 nights, it is very well located, to everything, 5 mins to ginza station. Lawson and mcdonalds near by, we had a nice room , small but ok. the bed was really good.the staff was very good too and the manager very kind , and gave good tips , where to go , thank you . keep it up .

Here for two nights pre-cruise and this was a great location. The hotel is clean, modern and very quiet. We were on the fifth floor and had no noise pollution either from neighbours or outside.The hotel is easy to get to, surrounded by many subway stations. Our first time in japan and we took the subway, getting here easily after a short walk from the station. As others have indicated, there’s a McDonald’s in the same block and lots of stores like 7-11, Starbucks and high end retail nearby.We particularly enjoyed going into the ‘Food Stage’ level of the Matsuya department store a black away, where there was fantastic fresh food on sale and many taste tests available.We had booked a privilege room, and I am not sure if it was because of this, or is a standard feature here, bu we greatly appreciate the extra benefit of having a smart phone in our room that we could take with us on our travels and use to make free local and international calls. We were also delighted when we got an early check in — our room was ready on arrival at 11am.It is worth noting that this hotel does not do lunch, dinner or room service. This was not a problem for us as there were so many great food options nearby. We would definitively stay here again when visiting Tokyo.

The hotel is very modern and centrally located in Ginza. What i like about this hotel is its location. Very short walk going to the many shops and malls in Ginza. Very accessible, basement of the hotel is the local train station. About 15min walk to the main JR Tokyo Station. Hotel has its own restaurant but a little more expensive. If you are feeling a little trifty, there's a McDonald's store and a number of convenience stores (Lawson, Family Mart, 7Eleven) just right across the corner. There are also numerous restaurants offering local fare, e.g. ramen, tonkatsu, sashimi near the vicinity of the hotel.The rooms are very clean and the staffs are very helpful. Wifi is complimentary. We utilised our membership points so we were upgraded to a grand room on the 12th floor. We booked a total of 3 rooms since we were 3 families. Other 2 rooms were only standard rooms. The Grand room was good for family of 5pax, we were 3 adults and 2 kids aged 13 and 8. Snacks and beverages on the minibar were all complimentary. Coffee maker and tea pot were also available. My only comment is about the bathroom. It was quite small and the shower/ bath tub area on the room that we stayed in has no curtain so we were careful in taking a shower to prevent water spilling on to the bathroom floor. We stayed at Rm 1216. On our last night, we transfered to a standard room. It can only accomodate 4 pax. One of our kids joined their grandparents on another room. The room has the same size of bathroom. There was a shower curtain on the bathtub area. However, one of the cabinet door was off it's hinges and had tendency to fall off. We never bothered to call guest services and just left it as it was. Overall, the hotel was nice. Only recommendation i can give is to improve on their quality control to correct minor defects.

The hotel was located in the shopping district of Tokyo called Ginza. There are good transport links within a 5 minute walk away. The famous fish market is about a 10 minute walk away from the hotel. The hotel was clean and the room was a good size. The staff were really helpful. I would stay there again.

The Mercure was booked by our travel agent and was a good choice. In Ginza, a bustling area with restaurants, shopping and direct access to a metro line in the basement of the hotel, we felt part of Tokyo. There's a convenience store at the end of the street, and a McDonalds and Starbucks as well. The room we were in was on the third floor, small and perfectly formed, but a little dreary in terms of natural light because of the building opposite. It had everything we needed - except for power points near the bed and enough power points in accessible locations. We ended up charging devices in the bathroom because they were the easiest power points to get to. I appreciated having the kettle in the room so I can make tea. Check in staff are excellent - truly some of the best I have interacted with over the many years I've been staying in hotels - and they go above and beyond what is normally expected of reception staff. The bar and dining area could do with a refit and I noted that only breakfast will be served in the restaurant after 30 April. Breakfast is the standard hotel buffet fare, but it's enough and it's good. The bar area does need a little work to more it more 'cosy' and comfortable though.All in all, a good stay, no problems and very good service.

We flew into NRT then took JR Rail to the Tokyo station (the main hub) and walked approximately 15 to our hotel. We only had backpacks and carry-on size luggage so there were no issues with getting our gear there for us. The entrance is not grande so pay attention or you might walk right past it. Take the elevator to the 2nd floor for check in.We were immediately greeted by someone fluent in English, very pleasant and helpful. Our room had 2 double beds and what they called a fold-out sofa, though I think it was the largest bed of all.The room came with shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, toothbrush kits, hair comb kits, cotton swabs, a safe, and a tub/shower combo. WIFI was included (not great but sufficient). Most impressive - there was a cell phone in the room for us to take with us around Tokyo and make local or international calls, and to use for navigation, etc. The breakfast served on level 2 is fantastic. Both of our kids ate free (age 16 & 13), making it very affordable for us. In the Ginza area and very close to high-end shopping and different train line stations.Mini bar food and drinks were included in the price of the room. Variety of good teas/coffee in the room.Very pleasant!

Although the rooms are perfectly adequate, the location is ideal, and we are generally fans of Accor hotels, this one had such terrible service (cigarette smoke in the room; extremely food receptionist: chaos in the lobby) and was so disorganized (mistake in status so that we did not receive benefits until later after we pointed this out) that we cannot recommend. We arrived at the hotel on Friday evening and were greeted by a scene of extreme chaos at check in. When we were finally given the keys to our room, we were shocked to find that it reeked of cigarette smoke. We called reception to request a new room. To this request, we were asked, “Have you used the bed? Don’t mess up the sheets!”Perhaps so they can foist the room on the next guest without another cleaning, despite the excessive cigarette smoke? You have all been warnedRudeness aside, the hotel is chaotic. There is no priority check in, and seemingly no order in which customers are served. The hotel had also mistaken our Accor status number so that we did not receive the benefits (drinks, room upgrade) until later in the stay. Check out was not much better, with only a single receptionist working at 10:45.While we appreciated the status conferred room upgrade halfway through our stay, the room did not become available until late afternoon so that we were left without a room during the day of the upgrade. When we checked in with the receptionist at 3:30, we were told that the room had not yet been cleaned.
user_name:
chiek2013
New York City, New York

review_body: Cannot believe how small and cramped the rooms are here as we barely have room for our bags . Suggest you check the rooms first.Apparently the rooms are earthquake proof with massive beams taking up all the space.

Pros1) location is in Ginza, 2 blocks away from the shopping street but still in the quiet side2) convenient shops less within 2 blocks There is a 24 hour mc donalds, two starbucks, lawson store, ippudo, tenya. 3) rooms are clean, fresh, updated and relatively large for Japanese Standards4) free wifi, and mobile phone Cons1) housekeeping services are not at par with Accor and Mercure Standards. Poor cleaning of our attendant in the bathroom. 2) front desk staff are able to satisfactorily address guest concerns on directions, transfers, accommodations. They lack warmth.

The rooms are clean and spacious for japan standards... Great hotel for families. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was very good with enough choices. Location of the hotel is perfect as just above the subway and a lot of restaurants nearby...

Stayed at the Mercure for our Honeymoon the location is fantastic and very easy to find ideal from Narita Airport . The hotel staff are very polite and our room was lovely. We included breakfast witch had plenty of choices. Next time I visit Tokyo I will be staying here again. Special thank you for our wedding gift and little note x

It’s a small, modern hotel right next door to designer labels and flagship stores. There’s an underground connection leading to a couple subway stations. So, very convenient for shopping and getting around.Tokyo JR station is a bit farther – about 15-20 min by walk from Marunouchi South exit 八重洲南口. (It’s actually closer, ~10 min, via Exit 2 of Keiyu Line 京葉線but you’ll have to walk up 3 floors) – manageable as we didn’t have a lot of luggage but still less than ideal. The airport bus station at Ginza is closer (~7 min by walk), and it’s cheaper (1,000 yen versus well over 3,000 yen of Narita Express). So, we took the bus when we left for the airport.The room itself is also small but well-appointed – there’s even a smart phone available for our use in town (with free wi-fi and calls!)Overall, our stay there was satisfactory. But the price of this hotel is not cheap. If we don’t have to stay in the Ginza area, we might explore other options next time.

We stayed here for three nights and found it to be fine for our requirements. Good access to transport links and Ginza itself is awash with fab restaurants for a variety of budgets (reserve in advanced if you can). We ate at Kushiyaki Bistro Fukumimi one night, it was fantastic and only a few hundred meters from the hotel. The staff were very helpful in booking restaurants, suggesting places to visit and were generally polite and courteous. There is no dining facilities after breakfast, but step out of the hotel and you don’t have to go far to find somewhere to eat. There is a bar, which opens from 3pm. Special mention to the breakfast staff who were all really welcoming and friendly; we found the breakfast to have a good selection of options and which were replenished frequently (the hotel was very busy when we stayed last weekend). Rooms are compact and yes space is limited but for a few days in this bustling city, the Mercure Ginza is a very good choice :)

This has been our 3rd trip to amazing Japan but our first one to Tokyo. We stayed with friends for most of the time but as we also wanted some city centre time, we booked two nights at the Mercure Hotel in Ginza. The location is great - we arrived by public transport and the Ginza station is only a short walk away (there are several stations, depending on where you come from, check it out). We took the subway to Shibuya the next day and to some other spot the 2nd day so the location was very convenient and really close. The Tokyo station is around 15 to 20 minutes walk from the hotel. A quick note on Ginza: it has some really fancy department stores (if you are into luxury things, this will be paradise for you). There are some great restaurants nearby (around the corner there is some fried pork restaurant that is amazing or check out A Happy Pankcake (10 minutes walk - expect to queue for a table). The Imperial Palace (and the public Imperial East Garden) is around 15 minutes walk away. For anything else, use public transport - it will bring you there safely. Upon arrival we were given a very warm welcome, everything was prepared. We got an upgrade - something that is part of my Club Accor membership but at the same time can not be taken for granted (it happens that they are fully booked). I hardly get it in France but it seems that in Tokyo they took this very seriously! They were super friendly and we were quickly in our room on a high floor (as per our preferences). The room was super nice - I have been told that the hotel was renovated around October 2018. Please note that the room was of a very decent size - generally hotel rooms in Japan are small but compared to the room we had during the weekend with our Japanese friends (a small hotel in Kizarazu) it was really spacious. The room was very clean - we got a welcome bottle of wine and some delicious bisquits amongst some other small goodies (not sure if this is the standard or linked to my membership - but small gestures make a big difference for me). We walked 20 km every day to see some of the best places and it was so nice coming back to the hotel in the evening just to relax. The room was excellent for that purpose. The breakfast provided a good selection - I won't judge as I am really not into breakfast (that is the one meal I don't really need). It had everything we needed for a good start of the day - especially good coffee and friendly staff!Remember, this is a Mercure Hotel - not a 5 star palace but we felt like Queen and King and were totally happy. The day we checked out was my birthday and would you believe it they congratulated me before proceeding to check us out. I got a small gift and I was so happy. Again, a small thing but it made such a big difference for me. As we left our luggage in the hotel for the day, we had to come back to get it in the evening. I then met the Reception Manager and he again wished me a wonderful birthday. He knew everything - the fact that we were happy and also which colleague checked us in on Sunday. This is what I call attention to detail. I am sure when he reads this review he will remember - especially as during the holidays my attire is more like Heavy Metal than suit and tie oriented :-)It is a too bad that Tripadvisor does not allow me to give more than 5 points - Mercure in Ginza would so deserve it. Now I am back in France and guess what? I am writing this review from a Mercure Hotel in Tours. The service is somewhat different. As I choose the same hotels most of the time, they now give me the upgrade most of the time (big thank you) but no one would every say: Nice to see you again, thank you for your loyalty and so on. Asian countries (I have been to many countries around there, my wife is from Hong Kong) have a different attitude when it comes to service. Overall I can recommend the Accor Hotels (I would not stay with them otherwise) but the Mercure in Ginza is besides the Sofitel in Dubai my absolute favorite so far. Thank you for making a difference, thank you for contributing to a wonderful vacation and I am sure we will see each other again. Please thank all of your staff for everything they do - it makes a difference in peoples life.

First of all, the location is great - it's very central and the hotel is surrounded by shops, restaurants and subway stations on various lines. The Kabukiza is within walking distance as well.The provided smartphone makes exploring a breeze - it really is becoming an essential part of any hotel's offerings. Early and late checkouts are handy and not terribly expensive (well, compared to how much you have to pay for a room that has enough space for two suitcases lol). The wifi is very fast.It would have been nice to be able to get room service or eat dinner in an on-site restaurant. This hotel does not offer either of those options. I can accept that, but they leave paperwork (the usual "hotel information") in the rooms that vaguely says the restaurant will remain open until May, but they don't specify that they mean May 2018!They still do breakfast but it's fairly ordinary. Go to the nearby 7/11 instead - you'll save a lot of money (and their food is surprisingly good).

When i arrived at the hotel, in the street, there was no one, no front desk no one to help, i Had to sneak around to find a cart to put my suitcases..... The front desk i located at the 2 nd floor.The room is simple and the bathroom is out of age you have to climb to access the old bathtube etc...The terible is there were no room service at all ! I would ever had reserved to this cheap hotel if I knew. Underneath the bed you find dust bunnies...........nO ONE TO HELP I had to gat the cart to check out and alone in the street .

The best part about Mercure Ginza is its location. The hotel sits on top of the Ginza-Itchocme metro line (Just need to press B1 and you’re at the station). It is in a quiet spot that faces an office building, but just walk three minutes down the street and you are in the heart of the Ginza shopping district (Look for the LV store and turn in). And there are a 24-hour MacDonald’s and Lawson a minute away.However, be prepared that most of the rooms do not have much of a view (they face an office building so you can peek into the cubicles of office workers ) and there isn't a pool or onsen facilities. However, the hotel’s facilities are a winner. The lobby is designer chic and cozy. I stayed in a twin room that came with ample room - there was even a comfy armchair with leg rest and a fashionable overhanging lamp. The toilet’s bathtub is spacious by Tokyo’s standards and I like the overall design from the lift lobby. The bed rest also has a classy chic design, something that you don’t usually associate with budget business hotels My stay also came with breakfast that I looked forward to waking up to. Expect a mix of local and Japanese food, such as pasta, karaage, scrambled eggs and lotus root, with a wide variety of drinks. I hope to be back at the Mercure Ginza again.
