Within walking distance to the JR trains and Metro subway which meant we could get anywhere easily. The room was a reasonable size and well kept. We had the buffet breakfast each morning and found plenty of choices. Staff were helpful and our overall stay was great.

Seems like every hotel in Tokyo is pretty pricey, but this one was fairly reasonable. Extremely clean, quiet, nice rooms. Rooms are small compared to American standards, but workable. 731 yen (about $7) taxi ride from Tokyo Station, where the the NEX train from Narita stops.In the heart of Ginza, easy access to all sites in Tokyo, with a metro in the basement. Would recommend.

First ho to find this place (if you are using subway) take the exit A13 walk, walk another 100-150 meters, take first right walk another 100 meters (you can see a starbucks at your right) and hotel is just at corner of 3rd Block in front of lawson / family mart. Mcdonalds is within hotel building.reception is on 2nd floor. rooms are small but Ok. hotel location is superb, staff is very Nice. Breakfast selection is limited but good, you can order some fried eggs. Staff at restra is very nice specially ricardo from spain.well i would say its a value for money.

Stayed here with the family for only 1 night as we had a booking at another hotel which was full for the first night. I was presently surprised with the hotel and especially the service. The staff are extremely good and try to help you out. The hotel is not extremely big but does have a restaurant but does not have room service (this is not really the end of the world as there are plenty of restaurants nearby and the department stores have food courts that are better than hotel food ). Rooms while not large are decent size for Japan (I have seen and stayed in much smaller) and the location is great if you want to take a walk around the Ginza area and soak in the sites. Also located right near (above ) a train station. For those looking to stay in the area at a reasonable hotel without paying through the nose then this is it.

I picked this hotel as it was fairly close to Tokyo Train station and I was coming in from Narita catching the Narita Express. While My map on my cell phone gave out (no wifi) and I got disoriented when coming out of Tokyo Airport, I still managed to walk it pretty easy with wheely bag to the hotel. For others you can change trains and get to a closer station (several to choose from) or a cab would be pretty quick and easy. Walk was all flat though and about 1800m.Hotel was clean and tidy, nice rooms, close to subway stations and plenty of food and bar options all around.I was leaving via Haneda and it was even easier. Direct Train from Higashi-Ginza station (200m away) to Haneda.Would definitely stay here again. Excellent.

The location is the best part of this hotel. Very close to lots of good restaurants and shopping. Room was small (no view). Room and bathroom could have been cleaner. Room felt like it could use a major refresh. Bedding was, however, very comfortable. Room was too warm - air conditioning was on maximum cool and still too warm. Wifi was free. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was pricey and we decided to eat at one of the nearby restaurants. Would probably choose to stay elsewhere next time.
user_name:
DCguy20002
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel has a good central location near shops, restaurants, metro stops and is a short walk to the kabuki theater and fish market. The room was large and comfortable and the staff was helpful. There is also a restaurant on-site. We did not eat at the hotel but it was ok for a glass of wine.

We stayed for one night. Ginza is very lively, so location is great, you have many department stores, restaurants etc around the corner. Quiet location. Lacks some kind of personality, as if this could be anywhere in the world... No Japanese touch at all, except for the personnel, very kind.

Typical Mercure Hotel. NIce clean large comfortable rooms. Very different from the Japanese standards. Well located and great staff. I have spend 2 stays at that hotel and it was quite refreshing compared to some of the Japanese business hotel. The cost is very reasonable.

Stayed there for 2 night, first time to visit Tokyo.This is an old Hotel but still well maintained. Centrally located in Ginza area (high end fashion district). Pros of this hotel:- Central Location in Ginza, easy to find restaurants and shops nearby- 5-10 mins walk to some stations (depend to which station you are heading to)- Large room for Japan standard with proper bathup (not the mini bathup), complete amenities- Clean and well maintained propertyCons :- Staff not so friendly (also not mean, just very formal. more smiles will be better)- No upgrade for Platinum Accor Plus member, except for welcome drink- Not so easy when you are going to airport from this hotel. you need to drag your luggage to the nearest station.Just found out than during Sunday afternoon-evening the main Ginza street is closed for cars (or it's only during that period when we were staying only?). So it's perfect timing to walk around the area. people are dressed up. very nice ambience.FYI, Qantas crew are staying in this hotel.

I stay here with my family (11 years old daughter and my wife). In term of room condition is not special, but in term of location it is very good since there many good place only walking distance from this hotel like tsukiji market, kabuki theater, kyukyodo (stationary store) and Higashi Ginza Station underneath of this hotel using elevator. The service of the crew also very good and friendly.

Stayed in this hotel because of my Le Accor membership. Nothing fancy, rooms are on the average side for Japan standards, staff are quite stiff but can communicate well in English. Area is ok if your on business or would like to visit branded shops.

We stayed here twice during our visit - at the start and end of our holiday. On both occassions the receptionist staff could not be more helpful, letting us have our room before the 2pm check in times. The rooms are small but roomy enough for a long stay with adequate wardrobe/shelving so you are not living out of a suitcase. Plenty of TV channels and a bilingual function that allows you to watch in English as well as Japanese. They kept our cases in between our visits so we didn't have to carry them all around our tour of Japan. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to rail links, restaurants, shops and bars. We would not hesitate to return again.
user_name:
Holi-Ray
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and I was quite pleased with my stay. As a leclubaccor platinum member I got a complimentary upgrade note from the manager and a small bottle of champagne which were a very nice touch. The location is unbeatable with a Tokyo metro station literally underneath the hotel whilst JR pass users should take note Yurakucho station is also a short walk away and can use the lines there to go to a lot of places in Tokyo for free. The rooms were small but functional and the buffet breakfast / buffet dinner are nothing to write home about but all in all. A good hotel in a great location.

This big hotel is located just few streets away from the snobbish Ginza luxury shopping area. The Ginza-itchome station on Yarakucho subway line is accessible directly from the basement of the hotel. And if not convenient, 3 other subway lines are close by.This hotel has nothing outstanding compared to any other hotel of the chain. Everything is simple and functional. The access to the rooms is made from a long and cold corridor. My room was relatively small, but still spacious enough to walk comfortably. It is equipped with TV, mini-fridge and wi-fi. Everything was clean.The bathroom is spacious, especially considering that we are in downtown Tokyo. It is not the modular bathroom that we usually see in Japanese business hotels. I particularly liked the sliding door which is a touch of Japanese architecture. Towels and toiletries are abundant. As the room, everything was clean.Complimentary breakfast is wonderful. It is buffet type and the variety is fair. The pains au chocolat were crispy & sublime. Service was very courteous from all staff members. In rush hour, the elevators were insufficient.

The hotel is located right above Ginza Itchome station which is quite well connected. however the Ginza station was more frequently used by us. We were happy with the service. The rooms are slightly small, which i suppose is a "Japan thing", otherwise very well appointed.

It was my first visit to Tokyo and as an older woman on my own, I found the hotel very suitable. The staff members were friendly and helpful, the single room was clean, quite spacious and well equipped. Breakfast was good with European and Japanese breakfast dishes on offer. I had one buffet dinner In the hotel and thought the variety and quality was mediocre. The location was excellent, in a quieter part of Tokyo, within walking distance of Tokyo Station, the main department stores and other attractions. There is an entrance to the subway directly from the hotel. I thought it was a good value reasonable place to stay but would benefit from done updating.

We stayed here twice recently and found the rooms to vary in size slightly, the ones with extra storage are much better. For Tokyo and the price point the rooms are very good. There is an elevator to the met line, but this is not a direct line to Tokyo station, its easier to walk or get a taxi to the station. Access to everything Ginza has to offer is very close and the staff are very helpful in assisting you to find what you need. A good hotel choice for the area.

I have stayed in Mercure hotels in the past and the Tokyo Ginza hotel is one of the better ones. The rooms are large and very nicely decorated, very nice furniture, very large beds, extremely comfortable. Very nice Japanese style bathroom, everything spotless, also nice amenities such as a fridge and espresso machine. The rooms are very quiet. You also access the rooms directly from the street level without having to go through reception, so very convenient. The service was very good and friendly. The breakfast was nice but not included in the room price, so a bit pricey (this is Tokyo), but the hotel offered a 20% discount if booked beforehand. The hotel is in the heart of Ginza, shopping district, everything on your door step. I will most likely stay at the Mercure Ginza again.

I chose this hotel for its location. Sitting in a side street in Ginza, you really can't get more central than this.However, when the taxi dropped me off in front of the hotel, I couldn't really believe it. There was just a glass door leading to two elevators and nothing else. I thought I was at some back door of an office building. Turned out the reception was on an upper floor and one had to take the elevator there to check in first, then further up to the room.Needless to say I didn't find it very welcoming.But check in was very efficient. Staff very helpful in pointing out late night eateries nearby (and the recommendation was very good).Despite the great service, I couldn't but be disappointed again upon entering the room. It was really quite small. Lucky I was single and didn't bring my wife with me to this trip, else I'd imagine the complaints.But if all you care is the location, you do get to spend the night in a great spot in spotlessly clean conditions without breaking the bank in one of the most expensive cities in the world.

Super location for shopping in Ginza, lots of restaurants, the great fish market and a local park. From the airport take the line which stops at Shibashi and you do not need to change. The hotel staff are helpful and proved good tips. The only negative was the in the "Jazz Bar" which claimed to have live music but turned out to be music from some unknown artist be played by a CD player. You should know that drinks are expensive in Tokyo unless you go to local bars. The room was meant to be non smoking but it clearly had been used by a smoker and I guess that is why they had a humidifier in the room.

The Mercure Ginza Tokyo has great location, steps from the subway system, business district, restaurants and Tokyo's famous fish market.The Mercure staff is very professional and helpfull. They make them selves available every time.The rooms are comfortable, but small. However, I do think that it's more of a Japanese thing then a hotel thing, where space is a commodity. Yes I would stay here again.

The Mercure Ginza was everything we required on a recent trip to Tokyo. I wanted an easy walk from the Tokyo train station, to be within the Ginza, a comfortable bed and a high floor room to alleviate any street noise. Although we found the hotel ok, we really struggled to find reception and I think more specific signage would be helpful. Normally we stay at The Peninsula but as this was a different style of trip (no kids and back packs instead of suitcases), I wanted no frills, but comfort and cleanliness. I got exactly this. My request for a high floor was granted, the bathroom was of an adequate size, tea and coffee facilities within the room, but most importantly, the most sound sleep I think I've ever had in a hotel. The beds are really comfortable. McDonald's was downstairs for our way home from Bar300 and a couple others and the next morning was an easy walk back to the train. I just wish we'd had breakfast at the hotel because although there are a plethora of incredible evening dining options, I'm yet to find anything half as good for breakfast. Prior to travel I researched intently the hotel to stay at and for the money I felt this was the best option. I really think it was & I'd stay here again on a similar trip.

The main reason we chose Mercure was because of its location. Perfect location to explore Ginza and close to subway stations. We enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend it to family and friends if they want to be located at a convenient location. We also would like to thank Nikita for making sure that our stay was as pleasant as possible even before we arrived. We greatly appreciate your time and assistance via emails and throughout our stay. We had free Wi-Fi in our room and the reception was good. We will definitely consider Mercure again for its location.

the hotel is approx. 2 blocks far from Ginza shopping area (luxury shops).rooms are small, and very old.I don't think I would go there again.overall it is below average and I don't think I would go there again

A well located hotel but what a disappointment, a rather apathetic welcome to the hotel. On entering the room we found hair on the bathroom floor, which following a visit to reception was cleaned while we were out. Our room was small, not much space for a suitcase. Bed wasn't comfortable at all. On visiting the bar for a drink at 2130hrs was told the was closed, not even a coffee available. Breakfast was a good buffet and well managed, good attentive staff there. My wife and I are both Acorr Platinum members and as such generally get a warm welcome not so here,

Mercure Tokyo Ginza is one of my favorite hotels on my visits to Tokyo. Aside from its very strategic and convenient location, the hotel offers many other pluses. First and foremost, the nightly rates are quite reasonable for a 4 star hotel in such a location. Rooms are quite spacious for Japanese standards and the hotel is kept clean and tidy. One negative comment would be to avoid the smoking floors as the smell of smoke has entrenched itself into the walls and carpets.

We stayed here overnight for our last day in Tokyo before flying out back home. We decided to stay here because previously we had really positive experiences with ACCOR hotels & in particular this hotel was one of the only to boast a queen sized bed in its price range. Upon arriving at recpetion at Mercure Ginza we had to wait around 15 minutes to check in as the hotel "couldn't find" our reservation which was made online that same morning through the ACCOR website. We found reception quite cold and unwelcoming throughout this process. The room itself was small, although this is to be expected in Tokyo. As for the details, we were not really impressed. Our room walls were scuffed and dirty from contuined use and gave it a 'dirty' kind of feel. The bathroom was also in a similar state, the tiles in the bath had soap stains and the shower curtain needed replacing as it had several noticeable stains on it. We were not able to use the mini bar as it was not switched on and we couldnt locate the power switch. The bed was comfortable and firm. The negative details although seemingly minor, spoiled the experience for us. For roughly $AU250 per night we expected better.

We were really enjoy when staying in this hotel during our holiday in Tokyo. Despite the room was pretty small but the service was top notch. Food and beverages during breakfast were so enjoyable and delicious. Overall a perfect choice for us.

never ever had so unfriendly staff at Front office like Yukito Hattori FOM at an Accor Hotel round the globe, be careful, they charge you breakfast and minibar you never used and force you sign all papers in japanese language! FOManager was more than rude and unfriendly.

We booked a Deluxe room with 2 queen beds. At check in I was told the room was standard with 2 singles. I showed them the confirmation and it was sorted. The room was a great size for 2 adults, the room was clean and comfortable. The pillows were hard like bricks and I asked for softer pillows and 2 were delivered immediately. The quick walk to the Ginza metro is easy and central. Restaurants in the area are plentiful. A 10 minute walk to the Ginza Corrider where there are excellent restaurants and bars. I asked at the desk for restaurant recommendations and we tried one and it was great. Yes, the room rate was expensive, but it was worth being so central in Tokyo. A great stay!

Stayed five nights in a deluxe room as a Le Club platinum member. The deluxe rooms are of decent size for Japanese standards. The hotel building itself and the rooms are not particularly pretty or fancy in any way, however our room was spotlessly clean and the bed quality was good. Small TV. No view from the rooms as you look straight into another big building. As a platinum member I only received the welcome drink vouchers after asking for it. The roomcharge for my whole stay had also been double charged to my credit card at the day of arrival, which I pointed out to the front desk on day one. No excuse offered. This matter got sorted out on day 5. When I requested late check out at 4 PM as a platinum member I was told by the front desk that I could stay until 2 PM and only against a charge. I wish that the staff was properly trained in the Le Club programme. However, after a long embarrassing wait this matter matter also got sorted out. However, I do not like to beg for my perks and having to explain the hotel's loyalty programme to the staff. This hotel'sbiggest asset is the perfect location in the middle of the Ginza shopping area, it can't get any better. All in all I recommend this hotel for it's unbeatable location.

The average hotel with the average quality of services. Indifferent staff and stubborn management. "Pay, try to stay quietly and go quickly away!". No quality at all for your money (EUR 160 + taxes for the Standard Single Room), bofff...

Our family of 3 stayed here for 3 nights just after Christmas. This hotel has a fantastic location in Ginza, close to subway and train lines, great high end shopping and food options in the depato. It is set back two blocks from Chuo-dori, so our view was ok but not scenic. We were split between two rooms (not connected), and both were super clean and comfortable although a bit small as is the standard in Japan. Breakfast was good and staff did a good job of restocking and all were very pleasant. There were 2 issues that we had while staying here. First was the temperature of the rooms. The thermostats were set at 28 degrees Celsius. After much discussion at reception (after trying myself with the controls in the room) I was made to feel incompetent for asking if the room could be made cooler. She eventually reset our rooms to a lower temp and told me not to touch the controls during our stay. Then, the next morning the phone rang in our room and the front desk was asking if we could pay our accommodation in full. We still had another 2 nights to stay, and are also Accor members and booked through our membership. No explanation was given for this. We payed but thought it was a strange request. So, a great stay in a great city, but unfortunately we must have missed all the great staff (front desk only, as everyone else was wonderful) that other reviewers have praised.

Extremely small rooms. Furniture was worn ( and torn in some cases).No room to put toiletries in bathroom. The room was extremely dated.We arrived late after a long flight from Melbourne and I was disappointed there was no room service. Ended up eating McDonald's - not an ideal introduction to authentic Japanese food!1 km from Tokyo Station.We only stayed one night as we were headed to Hakuba, so it was bearable.Staff were great - spoke English and were very helpful.Breakfast, which was provided, was ok - easier to have at Hotel on the day of travel.

Excellent proximity for all your shopping needs at Ginza - perfect location at the end of your stay for some shopping. Breakfast buffet was basic. Great service from the Frenchman at the restaurant. Has a subway stop at the basement which makes it convenient. We would stay again.

This hotel is well located, steps from all the best department stores in Ginza and close to the subway. I'd booked three rooms and am an Accor Club member but that didn't make any difference to the rooms that we were allocated. They are very small but very well serviced. Despite there being a dedicated line for members I queued with everyone else and when I forgot something had to go to the back of the queue and start again! I booked on the basis of being a member but wouldn't bother in the future.

For non Japanese travellers who use JRPass, the closest train station to this hotel is Yurakucho Station (about 10 mins walking). Actually this hotel is directly connected with train station (Ginza Ichome) however, it is not within JRPass coverage. So you have to change the line to Yurakucho Station. The room as well as its bathroom was clean, not that big but decent for 2 persons. Near convenient stores and fast food (McDonalds). The staff are nice and friendly.I don't know what is the best view that this hotel has, since our room was facing emergency stairs/exit.Overall, we found that this hotel may become alternatives for our next trip.

We were worried about how to reach the city from the airport as we learned the taxi was not a wise option. Turned up it was only one direct trip from the Haneda Airport. Surrounded by subway routes. Walking distance to Tsukiji Fish Market. Perfect.

The hotel was nice and clean. The rooms were quite small, but that's hotels in Japan in general. The breakfast was decent, nothing to call home about. Location wise, not too bad since you're in the heart of the Ginza district. Great places to eat within walking distance at the fish market.

This was perfect for us as we spent all day out. The rooms were perfectly nice but small. Unfortunately didn't get adjoining rooms so had to split me and my husband. Area was great. Easy to get around on metro. Shopping centres and yummy food including yakitori at Torishige.

An affordable find in the Ginza. Efficient, clean with okay breakfast. Big treat was to find a real baguette and crescent on the menu in a little bistro right off the reception area of the hotel. Came in late and the bistro staff helped us pick out food and a bottle of wine to bring to our room. They even brought the tray to the room...unexpected.Advice: Do consider how much room you need. The economical room with a queen size bed was far too small for 2 people with luggage. We requested an upgrade to the larger room on the 10th floor that was perfect for 2.Bathroom was well stocked with good products, and a coffee bar made the morning an easy start.
user_name:
SusanjaneS
New York City, New York

review_body: This Mercure is a very pleasant hotel and a decent size room for Tokyo. The room was clean and comfortable with a bathtub which I liked. It is situated in a quiet side street with a Mcdonalds on the corner. It was easy to get around Tokyo from this hotel.

Whilst Ginza is definitely our favourite place to stay, the Mercure offered comfort and cleanliness but not a lot of luxury. However this is all relevant to price as well. We had 16 of us travelling (2 families) so this worked out to be cost effective for us. The rooms were tiny although hotel rooms in Tokyo always are. It was only for 4 nights and we spent all day and most nights outside exploring/eating and drinking anyway so we really just needed a bed. Staff were lovely.

I have stayed in this hotel approx. 7 times, and every time I am pleased with the value, the location, and the service. Simple but efficient rooms, and the restaurant is good for both western and Asian style breakfast. Certainly recommended for travellers in Tokyo.

We (2 adults and 2 children, 9 & 11) stayed overnight en-route to our ski resort as we arrived late into Haneda. They were able to confirm interconnecting rooms upfront, cater for our midnight arrival and even recommend a restaurant that was open nearby until 1am. Good breakfast and able to walk to Tokyo station to continue our journey the next morning.

Stayed 5 nights for holiday with family.Hotel is located within minutes from Ginza metro station, its actually embedded to one of metro station (have direct access) from other metro station but we dont use this line.The staff is very helpful, informative and efficient. They certainly know, what they are doing.Upgraded to higher room category, so my room is quite spacious.Hotel amenities are as expected.Below, you will find McD, Lawason, and other conv stores.Thumbs up for this properties

Excellent location, it's within walking distance to the shopping center of Ginza. Several convenient stores are nearby only 2-3 minutes walk. Mcdonald beside the hotel. Pharmacy store's also 2-3 minutes walking distance. You can also walk to Matsuya and Mitsukoshi just 5 minutes. Matsuya has a great arrange of food and dessert at basement floor.They had database updates before our arrival so they lost my booking information stating interconnecting room. The manager did upgrade the rooms and have adjacent rooms for us. That's good enough for us.

We stayed for 5 nights and had a good experience. The hotel is in a very good location, close to train station, shops, restaurants, etc. Our room had not much room to move around but was very clean. The hotel by its decor shows its age but is very presentable and amazingly clean.The staff are efficient and helpful. They assisted us promptly.
user_name:
Cindy S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed on the sixth floor for three nights. The check in was prompt. Our room was a good size with a separate bathroom. We also had a seat and bench for itinerary planning and a nice lounge seat for relaxing in. The bed was comfortable. We needed to have the AC on as the rooms were warmer than our preference, however they would be typical for Japan. WiFi worked well in the hotel. We had the full western buffet breakfast which we enjoyed. They also have local cuisine as well. This hotel is very well located in Ginza close to three subway stations and also the JR rail station. In fact you can catch a single train from Haneda airport to a station near the hotel. How good is that. Recommended.

Totally surprising week in Tokyo with side trips to Yokohama, Kobe and Nagasaki. First time in Japan, the people are very friendly, transit easy to use and great sightseeing.If you have ever been to Rome or Paris or similar and some one approaches to help, you know your at risk from a pickpocket or worse. In Tokyo and Japan generally the people are actually trying to assist tourists; even the police will try to help out.

Stayed here after Christmas with the family. We had 2 room connecting to each other with one room having a queen bed and the other with 2 twin beds. Checked in early in the day so the room was not yet ready, the hotel doesn't provide bellboy service so you have to bring all your luggages to your room by yourself. The rooms are relatively small, for a family of 4 the twin room is much recommended as the queen size bed in the other room can only accommodate 2 adults and a small child. The interconnection also is quite awkward since you can not open them fully due to the tight space. Both rooms were clean and functional and the beds are very comfortable to sleep in. Security is also good as you need to have a key to access your floor. The hotel is directly located under Ginza Itchome station and a short walk to Ginza Shopping District and Station with plenty of restaurants around. A McDonald's just below, A Lawson and Starbucks just across the street.The hotel is very good for a family in a budget who wants to be located near the Ginza district.

This is our 3rd visit to this hotel in the past 5 years. At first I was a bit skeptical to book it the 3rd round as I recalled the hotel had started to show the usual wear and tear during our 2nd visit in 2011. However I took the chance after reading all the other reviews and I like the fact the GM/hotel responded to several of the reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel rooms did not look old and tired at all, they were very well kept . The staff were also very helpful and professional, they responded to my queries promptly and helped us with the takyubin service. I would have given 5 stars if not for the not-so-good ventilation in the room. We were given 2 non-smoking rooms on the 7th floor, everything was perfect till the 2nd night. We were shocked by the heavy smoking smell when we returned to our rooms on the 2nd night, we called the reception and they tried to help by bringing 2 air purifiers, the air got better after an hour of so but the smell lingered for the next 3 nights. It was bearable and we did not want the hassle of moving rooms so we decided to stay in the same rooms. Although this had a slight negative impact on our experience, I am still impressed with their service.Overall I would still recommend this hotel for their service, accessibility and overall upkeep of the property. Do check with the hotels on the rooms if you need good ventilation due to health reason.

Stayed at Mercure Ginza Hotel several times.I am Accor Platinum Card Member. The hotel arranged room upgraded and late check out for me. Also gave a free drink coupon.The room was really graded to a bigger one (bigger than standard room). Very clean and comfortable.The location is good. Just two blocks away from Ginza Main Shopping Street. Will definitely stay at this hotel again in Feb 2016.

We had a fantastic stay in this hotel. It is situated in the hearth of "chic" Tokyo! It is great for shopping.Rooms are a bit small but it is normal in Japan. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.Food was very tasty. We ate most of our meals at the hotel. The only negative side is that the restaurant tends to close for private parties at dinner time but customers are not informed in advance, so it can be frustrating. Overall a great stay! We will come back if the opportunity arises.

Rooms are small but that is to be expected in Tokyo. The room was very clean and had everything you need including all of your little amenities. The staff were kind and very helpful and the location was great. Right next multiple train lines, high end shops and a 15 minute walk to the Tsukiji fish markets. It is extremely safe around here and as i female i would feel completely safe to walk around here by myself even at midnight. There is also a small convenience store across opposite the hotel. I would come back here again. It definitely does the job.

What I liked about this hotel was that we could get a twin bedded room, it was close to transport with a station in the basement (you still need to travel to Tokyo station one stop) and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Hotel close to Tokyo City airport (Haneda). 20 minutes to hotel.Very centrally located to shopping, bars and restaurants, Ginza-itchome train station on Yurakucho Line (basement level of hotel provides access to exit 11 of train station) and minutes from other Metro lines.Check in area reasonably small, rooms are quite small and difficult to set up a large suitcase in, a little tired, beds firm, pillows could be more neck supportive, bathrooms very clean with plenty of amenities, room was like an oven on arrival due to air con on very very warm due to 3 degrees C outside, free wi-fi was very average with regular drop outs, however despite above was just comfortable.Great location to numerous designer shops.Numerous attractions and museums to keep you occupied.Always hard to find a good coffee and couldn't achieve this objective during stay.

Great location. Very helpful staff. It was delightful stay. Easy to walk around, make your purchases and put the staff back in the room, have a break and continue on. The rooms are still a bit small but given the location... To be expected.

The best thing about this hotel is its centrality in Tokyo. Off the sides of Ginza, its location means that shopping, dining, services are all within reach of the hotel. The hotel is rather smallish and unlike other Mercure hotels in other parts of the world, the usual swimming pool and gym are missing from the hotel. No porters so you bring the luggage up yourselves. Nevertheless, we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay and given its convenience of location, had no concerns with amenities that were lacking in hotel. For our family, the fact that the hotel is near Tsukiji Market was perhaps the most significant impression as we had our sushi breakfast there almost every morning! Would recommend this.

Shocked as to how small the hotel was. Then I find that all hotels in Tokyo are tiny ! So please be ready for TINY ROOMS. - the hotel was comfortable, clean, tidy, quiet, had everything you need. Staff so friendly. I found it to be a very good location. Away from the real hustle & bustle but close enough to shopping & trains stations.

The plus sides:+Great staffs, very friendly, very helpful and informative+Great location (famous Ginza shopping area with international brands and labels, try the local eateries near the hotel, there are 3 subway stations within walking distance from the hotel)+Great Value+Very easy to access anywhere in Tokyo+Standard room is pretty big for a Japanese standard hotelMinus sides:-No complimentary water (which you can get at Lawson nearby)-Nothing elsePerfect place to experience modern Tokyo at the heart of the cityTips:-Check out Itoya stationery shop nearby -Check out Hakuhinkan Toy Park (my personal heaven) at the end of Ginza street-You can get pretty great deal when there's discounts and sales at shops around Ginza, so don't assume everything is 'expensive' here ;) Happy hunting!-Most of the shops in Tokyo closes at 08:00pm..better start early!

What a delight to return to this beautifully managed hotel for the second time in the same year. The GM Kamel and his staff certainly know how to welcome you thinking of every detail. The staff were so excited to remember us and make us feel like we were at home. My mother was travelling with us this time, she was feeling like royalty with the amount of attention we were receiving. Fantastic treat for us all, we look forward to returning soon.

I stayed at this hotel on Saturday 14 November. The room was typically 'Japanese small' but functional. Unfortunately my room did not have a view (unless you call a shabby neighboring building a view)The hotel is looking a little tired (I am not sure when it was last renovated). The location is excellent if you want to be close to the Ginza action.

Great location in the Ginza section of Tokyo. One night in a beautiful room with all amenities but deficient water supply (because we were on the 12th floor?) preventing from proper functioning of toilets. We were ill-advised by the front-desk staff who gave a wrong timing (too late) for the registration to attend the start of the bulk fish market... which was the main basis for our choice of the hotel.

I stayed one night at Mercure Ginza for free using my complimentary room as an accor advantage plus member, so complaining about this hotel is very unthankful but i'd like to give my honest opinion to make this place a better hotel.In my country, Indonesia, Mercure Hotel chains are glamorous 4 stars hotels so when i saw the entrance of the hotel i was a bit shocked because it didn't look like the entrance of a hotel at all, I thought it was a restaurant just like the other reviewer said. The lobby was very small and dark, which made it looked smaller. But then the staffs were very professional and efficient. Check in was smooth and i got a room right away.Now the room, i stayed at superior room with queen bed, the room was small just like typical hotel room in Tokyo, low ceiling, and again dark interior just like the lobby. Maybe someday when this hotel wants to renovate, I suggest a bright or maybe white interior to make the room feels larger, just like the bathroom, all white with large mirror, didn't feel small at all. No complimentary mineral water in room, make sure you get one before come to the hotel.The best feature of the hotel is location. Located in a quiet area of ginza but only steps away from the hustle and bustle of ginza shopping paradise. The hotel connects to ginza-itchome subway station, the yurakucho line there will take you to disney resort line. The ginza, higashi-ginza, and tokyo station are not far from the hotel so travelling around tokyo is easy.

love the location. close to the tokyo station. alot of JR and monorail entry. Its my second visit in tokyo. Huge shopping area with alot of branded stuffs. Always Got a complimentary drink. People at the front desk are very helpfull.

room is clean. the front desk people are very friendly and helpfull. its my second time staying at this hotel. And I still want to stay there again for my third visit. Love the environment, ginza area is a nice shopping area. Close to the tokyo station. easy to go everywhere. Got alot of JR and monorail entry.

This well located hotel in the Ginza area is a short 10-minute taxi ride from the Tokyo station. The Lobby is on the 2nd floor , a bit small for a hotel of this size making it stuffy and overcrowded at times. Check in was fairly efficient. We had booked a deluxe twin which was a reasonable 27 sq.mt size. Beds and pillows are comfortable allowing a good sleep. Room is provided with a Nespresso coffee machine ( which was very welcome) and free WIFI. If required, ironing board and iron is provided.Bathroom though small is adequate and modern with a good shower. Toiletries provided are decent and replaced on a daily basis. Towels too are fresh and good.The location of the hotel is great – in the Ginza area with lots of places to eat within walking distance and lots of shopping too !! The metro stations are close by making it very convenient to see the sights of Tokyo. Going to the Narita International Airport too is easy with the bus starting a short distance from the hotel.Staff at the hotel is well mannered and helpful.

Location: Strategically located in the heart of Ginza, this hotel also had a direct access to Ginza Itchome station. Check in : I came before the room was available, but nevertheless the staffs still were very helpful in helping me checking in and put my baggage in the concierge so that I can start exploring around.Check out: As Japanese standard, quick and efficient. They helped me to get a cab to TCAT as well.Room : For Japan standard, the room size was sufficient. It was very clean and thoroughly cleaned every day. The bed was really comfortable, and there was this buckwheat pillow (?) provided. The amenities were sufficient. The bathroom was really nice though small. Shower pressure was spot on, and the room infrastructure was well maintained.

Unobtrusively Delightful, this hotel ticks all the boxes for service, convenience and outstanding hospitality. A must stay in Tokyo's Ginza.Brian Brown-A visitor from Australia In 21 Oct 2015 Out 24 Oct 2015

Not the best hotel in the world but good location in Ginza and Tokyo. Good price and good food for breakfast. If you are an explorer then this hotel is in the middle of Tokyo. Shinjuku and shibuya are one side. Ueno is the other. Right on top of the metro so perfect to get about. You will need to use the metro to explore. Don't worry it's easier than the uk. Trust me.

What a fantastic location!Mind you I did get hopelessly lost finding the hotel the first time, and twice during my stay I was approached by lost looking tourists dragging luggage trying to find the hotel. I certainly recommend Mercure Ginza include clearer directions on how to get to the hotel from Ginza station as that is the easiest station to alight from if coming from the Airport. For those interested - A13 (no escalator), put Apple Store on your left (other side of road) and walk to Bulgari, turn right and walk a couple of blocks till you see the pillar with the Mecure sign - turn right. If you hit McDonalds you've gone too far. The entrance is a small double glass down with a menu and mini flags out the front - I thought it was the hotel restaurant the first time I saw it, not the actual hotel.I never caught the Yurakucho Line so all the comments about the hotel being over the Ginza - itchome station were irrelevant. For connectivity, Ginza station is by far worth the extra couple of hundred metre walk.Food wise, breakfast wasn't worth the cost imho, and given the amount of great and cheap food in the vicinity I'd skip that unless included in an offer. I didn't eat at the hotel for other meals.My room was a single and while smaller than I was expecting (even expecting a small room), it was adequate especially as I spent so little time in the hotel it didn't matter.The proximity to Ginza Station, the easy walk to the huge range of Gado Shita (mini restaurants under the railway over pass with <$2AUD per beer and amazing food) makes this hotel a good choice.However I don't think I would stay here again as the cost is greater than the benefits of location given the ease of use of the metro.

Since I have stayed at several Mercure Hotels in Europe, I wanted to stay at this hotel once, and I finally had a chance for the first time. At first, this hotel is in the heart of Ginza, Tokyo's best shopping area, and is close to Mitsukoshi and Matsuya Department Stores, so it's good for shopping. There are many great restaurants and also convenience stores around. Ginza 1-chome Station (of Tokyo Metro Yurakucho Line) is underneath the hotel and Ginza Station (of 3 Tokyo Metro Lines) is a 5 min walk, and thus it's also convenient to go anywhere in Tokyo. I stayed in a deluxe double bed room which was nice and clean with a comfy Simmons bed. This is not a gorgeous hotel, but an affordable hotel at very convenient location.

Good location and price. Friendly Staff who gave us plenty of tips of where to go for dinner. The front desk spanish guy was very helpful with our stay, providing first hand knowledge of the area!!!!!

The best part of the Hotel is the excellent location! Stayed in the Deluxe room in the hotel (the Deluxe rooms are at the end of the corridor, and involve quite a walk). Comfortable stay, neat and clean, walking distance to Ginza main street. Breakfast is expensive and not that great. Mostly ate outside at the many nearby joints. View from rooms is of the adjoining buildings and not very nice. The hotel also has no pool. The front office staff are rather uptight and one missed the usual Japanese courtesy and friendliness (the male staff was even rude and unhelpful -management please note!). The exception was Yuki Sotoyanagi at the front desk who was especially very kind to help us with our luggage and arranging the Taxi to the Airport etc. However, one has to be very careful while fixing the Taxi charge. We were told that the Taxi had been fixed for JPY 19000, but at the Airport the Taxi Driver insisted upon JPY 22500, saying the difference was towards highway charge etc. Not sure if this was legitimate!

we stay 5 nights here and the room is big (compare to other hotels in japan) and clean. located in the middle of famous ginza area, easy to access and 10 minutes walking from tokyo station and very close to ginza itchome station. they have a door connected to one of ginza itchome exit.the breakfast was ok, not too many variety and almost the same items everyday. but the croissant are the best ever. crunchy outside and soft inside.

Made a reservation for an none smoking room, they made me wait for two hours to get a room that smelled like an ashtray. Terrible hotel, bad service. The whole hotel smells of cigarettes, the windows are facing an ally and can't be opened.

nice hotel with good location,5 minutes walk from yurakucho station. Friendly and helpful staff, Clean and spacious room. But unfortunately we don't get room with our request and also no swimming pool or gym facilities. But we will be back if visit tokyo again.

Located at the north end of the Ginza with direct access to the subway from the lift and a number of other stations in walking distance. Staff were efficient, helpful and pleasant. The room was well equipped and reasonably sized. (something to be aware of in Japan). Breakfast was fine with a variety of cuisine. Plenty of convenience stores around for good quality budget meals. The bed was a touch too firm but acceptable and didn't cause any problems.

It was easy to find this hotel. Right on top of itchome-ginza subway station. It is close to the heart of Ginza. Check in was easy and staff was friendly. I like the restaurant's French decor and food was delicious. The twin bedroom was spacious enough for Japan's standard. Bathroom clean and not too small. There is Mcdonalds just beside the hotel, Starbucks just one street away. Lots of shopping nearby. Great experience, thank you.

Had a pleasant stay at this hotel in August. Our flight arrived at Tokyo early morning so our room was not ready when we arrived at the hotel. However staff kindly prepared a room for us as quickly as they could.The Ginza district is a good location. There is excellent shopping and a wide range of restaurants close to the hotel. There is direct access to a station from the Mercure.

This hotel was in a great location (if you're into designer shopping!). The room was on the small side, but I think that is pretty standard for Japan. Besides this the room was clean and well looked after. The hotel staff were extremely friendly they had multiple maps and were more then happy to point you in the right direction.We also had the Buffet Breakfast included in our seven night stay and it was fantastic! So much to chose from.Unfortunately the view wasn't that great, but having said that we barely spend any time in the hotel, we were to busy exploring.Would definitely recommend, and stay here again.

This was the last hotel in our three hotel holiday in Japan and the worst. The hotel is in a fantastic location, literally five minutes walk from the main shopping st. You come out by the Apple and LV stores. This is a budget hotel so you get what you pay for I guess. We booked as we wanted interconnecting rooms for our children. I found it hard booking for a family of 4 on the internet and this was one option in an area near sights we wanted to visit before we left Japan. The rooms are very small. They are old and tired and the bathroom supplies are basic. The in hotel dining is limited with NO ROOM SERVICE. The hotel restaurant is an expensive buffet which is not worth using when there are so many places to eat near by.We booked non smoking rooms and got one room that stank of cigarettes. Staff were OK, can do better in Japan for accommodation though. I would not stay here again we would go back to The Royal Park hotel which had an excellent family room (but was more expensive).If you are looking for a budget hotel, with basic supplies in a great location for shopping this is it.If you like a bit of luxury and larger rooms then look somewhere else.

You will feel comfortable if you are from west. The hotel is located in ginza area which is very happening and a lot of areas can be covered within walking distance. The rooms are a bit claustrophobic but that's essentially Tokyo's reflection. Besides that, everything is top notch. Bathroom has all toiletry essentials, clean & tidy. Room is well furnished within that small space which was a bit difficult to maneuver for 2 people. Breakfast was good enough. Most importantly, staff was very very helpful and were good to communicate in English. They even lent us 2 umbrellas as it was raining.

Nice little boutique hotel located in the gleaming Ginza.Pros: Amazing and helpful staffs who speak fluent English and always try their best to make our stay a comfortable one. Props to two Eurasian ladies (I think they are mixed of Japanese and European) at the front desk who direct us to Tsukiji Market and to print out Google map of Shibuya for us. I saw another European gentleman losing his item at the airport and a Japanese front desk male staff calling and trying his best to coordinate retrieving the item for him. Location is great! It looks a little off the main road at first but to a non-driving tourist, it is peaceful, quiet and only 3 minutes away from the main Ginza shopping strip and Ginza station. Louis Vuitton and Bulgari is only 2 minutes away.Room is small and compact but still comfortable with good beds, clean toilets and basic amenities. It only have 3 English channels though, and it can be improved on that. A HBO channel will make 1/2 of the world travellers very happy. Why not adding it? Did not try the hotel bistro although it looks cozy and cute, but what does it matter when a whole street of authentic Japanese cuisine is just a few minutes walk away?Cons:I'm just picking small faults here - the carpet at the hotel lift lobby is a little crumpled and hence dragging the luggages takes much more effort than usual. No pool but who cares about swimming in Ginza?I hate to reveal this little gem but I use my Accor free night and it is worth every penny. Even if I do not have my free night, I will be happy to pay a reasonable rate for this adorable hotel

I booked this place because everywhere else was full. And the price was great. Twins rooms are so much bigger than the queen bed rooms. Twins have two king singles. Breakfast is ok. Not amazing. But if u r used to 5 stars u will still be happy here. My only gripe is the location. Too far from the good sites. Subway under the hotels makes disneyland a breeze. But don't waste your time on Tokyo Disneyland. It's a sham. Two hour queues for 2 minutes rides. Absolutely disgusting. They should be ashamed of themselves. Even when u queue they will let 200 fast pass people who got there at 6am to queue jump in front of u. Totally repulsively managed park. Mercure staff all perfect. Very attentive. Good English. Make you feel safe and comfortable in a city that does not cater very well to English speakers. Mercure should be proud. Thanks for taking care of us

This is a standard hotel but perfectly adequate if you want somewhere clean, quiet, close to Tokyo station and the metro, and walking distance to the fish market.We didn't have the Buffett breakfast as it looked relatively expensive and there are so many coffee shops in Tokyo to choose from.It was good value for money. We would stay here again.Ask for a room on one of the higher floors.

We stayed here for one night in Sep 2015.The hotel is situated in Ginza, with close proximity to the metro station. It is only ~35 min from HND airport by metro.Room is spacious and clean. Staff and helpful and friendly.Overall an very enjoyable experience with this hotel. (A-)

Mercure Tokyo Ginza is very strategically located along the popular Ginza district. Rooms are quite comfortable (but be sure to request the double bed) even though they are rather small and compact. The buffet breakfast offered is also value for money.

Stayed for three nights and found it to be at a central location within easy distance of metro links. If designer shopping is your bag, then the Ginza district stores are just yards away.As far as hotel facilities, staff were helpful, breakfasts were adequate, rooms are fine and clean and you can have a limited evening meal if needed. However, do not expect any other facilities, and there are no nice views from the windows.

location is perfect. Right above JR station, within walkable distance with the metro station. near Ginza. mcdonalds and several convenience stores right at the corner. everything you need for a tourist. not many hotels in japan offers connecting room and the room is spacious. nothing special in design yet comfy to stay in. the lobby is so stuffy and hot when i get to wait for check in/checkout. not so good. maybe because of the heat.

Beautiful clean rooms, nice bathroom spotlessly clean and free wifi,Breakfast was one of the best I have had in any hotel chain with plenty of choices.The hotel is in an ideal location slightly off the main roads so traffic noise is almost non existent, the subway station is right underneath the hotel with access from the hotel lift.There is a huge choice of places to eat to suit all budgets and all within easy walking distance.The staff at all levels were a pleasure to deal with and no problems at all with language.Possibly one of the best city centre hotels I have stayed in and I would have no hesitation in staying again or recommending it-

Due to my membership with Accor, I got the place free for the night! I'd easily recommend the establishment to any travel due to its convenient location and close proximity to numerous establishments. I really enjoyed the simplicity and hospitality of the Mercure.

We stayed here for two nights in April at the end of our Japan trip, on two seperate slit night. The hotel kindly stored our case for the night we were out of town. The hotel is very well situated for shopping in Ginza and convenient for the main Tokyo Station. We got a very good room rate and for central Tokyo it was a bargain. The staff are friendly and the rooms staisfactory. I especially liked the Nespresso coffee machine in the room. We did not eat here so can not comment on that.If you are looking for a convenient, central hotel that is comfortable but not top end this uis a very good choice.

I chose Mecure Ginza for the location, close to the Tokyo Station where we arrived from Narita airport. It takes about 15 mins to walk to Tokyo station but I suggest if you have luggage it's only a short taxi ride.. The Ginza station is about a 6 minute walk and is the line that gets you to a lot of the attractions, a one day pass is ¥600. Close to the hotel is a convenience store, restaurants and coffee shops. The room we choose is a superior twin room which has the biggest square meterage and was just perfect.The beds are comfortable king Singles, wardrobe space a bonus so you're not living out of a suitcase.the room itself has a lot of natural light and also fitted out with good lighting both in room and bathroom. Air conditioning quiet and working well which is important when temps are in the high 30's, wifi excellent. Staff are professional, friendly and helpful.

Right in the heart of the Ginza area.Restaurants shopping bars everywhere.hotel staff are warm welcoming helpful.Rooms are small but everything you need including mini bar, kettle, ice machines.Also very quiet bliss

I stayed at the Mercure Tokyo Ginza in August 2015. The location of the hotel is great. It has a direct access to the metro system and is right in the Ginza area with all the shopping. However, if you're someone that was planning to do some work that requires Internet or wanted to call or update your Facebook, be aware. It wifi is really bad. It keeps disconnecting all the time and when it doesn't, it's really slow. I complained to the staff and got a new room with just as bad wifi. Apart from that, great hotel.

Hotel is centrally situated, an easy walk from ginza subway and local JR. Rooms are small but clean and good value.Staff extremely helpful. On arrival, our room was warm as air con needed to kick in and they found a fan in the store room to help. Staff at breakfast similarly good.

On arrival to this hotel reception is on level 5. Great speaking English at reception by all staff. Check in staff very helpful with pointing out things to do.Please note no pool or gym at this hotel. It's 36 deg and humid when I visited and a swim in the pool would have been great.Breakfast is a mix of Japanese and continental, no issues there.You can get an international travel adaptor from reception is a hand hint, power is 115v supply.Location is right in the heart of Ginza shopping district. There is also a train station under the hotel.Could not fault this hotel, I'll be back again

All the staffs were very polite and efficient, breakfast was ok, but the fact that they did not charge extra for children, thats a big plus. There are 3 metro stations nearby, itchomeginza is the closest, but ginza st is the most convenient , since its cover most of the metro lines. Room was a bit small, wifi access were better in the lower floors.

We booked this hotel as our friend tipped that the twin bedroom is spacious. Indeed the bed and room is spacious, can accomodate 4 people easily. However the bed and the pillow is a bit worn out.. the pillow is worse, it is already flattened.. I had bad sleep few nights. Staffs were standard, no extra ordinary service. We didnt try the restaurant. The room service is standard too.. they didn't mop the bathroom floor, and it got smelly after 3 days of use. Good thing is only the location, go to B1 and you are already in Ginza-Itchome station. Otherwise walk 5 minutes to Ginza, Higashi-Ginza or Yurakucho station to switch trains. McDonalds is next door and we went to Tendon-Tenya Tempura restaurant that is so good that we eat every day there. For me this is 3 stars hotel because of standard service. The rate is not interesting either...just spacious bedroom.

During my trip to Japan, Mercure Hotel had the best staff so far, friendly, good behavior, helpful, I only have good comments about them.The place is not noisy, the room was comfortable and I liked the bathroom as well.The breakfast buffet give to customers a large choice of food.This hotel is well located you can find subway stations not far to go to others main neighboorhoods.Also there is a mini market, a Mc Donald and a Starbucks not far. Moreover, there are many restaurant with affordable prices around the hotel.I highly recommend this hotel if you plan to stop by Ginza.

The hotel is right above the Ginza-itchome subway station of the Yurakucho line and is not far away from the Ginza subway station of the Ginza line. The room is small but is well equipped and cleaned. Bed is comfortable and the wifi is reliable. Staff is very friendly and make you feel welcome. Breakfast is nice with a good range of options.

Just walk for few minutes and you will get to Ginza. The room was clean and comfortable. Reception was polite and helpful. They give me an information that I need. The hotel is easy to find and quite area.

I thoroughly enjoyed staying here. It is in the expensive Ginza area but the quality of service--you can't beat. Breakfast was very good as well. It is close to Sony, Kabuki-za theater, shrines/temples, markets and metro stations.

Mercure is good location, good hotel but being Japan rooms are always small. Trainee girls at reception so this detracted from the experience but overall I would go back. Close to JR main railway and underground under the hotel. Breakfast OK but again being Japan they don't do western breakfast well so expect frankfurts and mexican beans but they tried.

This hotel is in the perfect location in Ginza Tokyo and perfect for anyone wanting to stay in Tokyo. Close to shops including department stores and plenty of eateries. There is a train line underneath the building which is great it you want to travel for the day in wet weather as you won't get wet. The room was the largest we stayed in throughout Japan, it was clean and very functional. The staff are friendly and helpful the reception managerJaviour was an amazing man who was so informative and very lovely to our children, they want to return just for his hospitality.This hotel is perfect for corporates, couples or families. The staff speak multiple languages which is extremely helpful. A great place, a great location.

The location is great. A lot of restaurants around and easy to get to train stations. Walking distant to Tokyo station. Staff are nice and friendly. Rooms are good sizes, as it is Japan, rooms are small, but gave you enough space and amenities to feel comfortable.

Mecure has again provided a great value hotel in an expensive city. A good sized room in a great location for a great price. The hotel is in easy walking distance from Tokyo Metro station. The hotel breakfast was a bit pricey but there are plenty of small cafe's in the area offering much better value breakfast. Also some very good traditional Japanese restaurants in the area. We had a great stay here prior to a cruise and the taxi to the cruise terminal approx $16AUD. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Strategic located with Ginza (luxury shopping street) just around the corner. Spacious room compared to other hotel rooms in Tokyo. Walking distance to Ginza-itchome train station which makes it very easy to get around in Tokyo. Friendly staff who speeks good english. Very good for the price. You have restaurants and shops nearby. Be aware though, food is more expensive here than other places in Tokyo. Bathroom is good, only negative is water pressure from the sink which is not that high, but shower was good.

Friendly staff who spoke good English, a very comfortable western-style room, ample sized bathroom, this hotel exceeded all my expectations except that the buffet breakfast was good, not excellent. There is no lobby at street level; you take an elevator to the second floor. Don't expect a view from your room; it's a fairly narrow street with another building opposite. Still, a delightful experience. You can walk there from Tokyo station, but not if you have heavy bags. It's about nine blocks south and nine blocks east.

Round the corner from Ginza Chuo Dori. Walking distance to Ginza metro station and has direct access to Ginza-itchome metro station. Twin room was spacious for Tokyo. Excellent concierge staff who assisted in booking restaurants and bus tickets for us pre-departure.

Located in the buzzing precinct of Ginza, with a train station under the building (major bonus to get around town), Mecure Hotel offers it all. Room for us parents plus one child accomodated with fold out bed and still enough space to move. Food in bistro at brekkie and dinner (yummy!!) (FYI kids under 16 eat free for brekkie) Wifi connection a dream! Customer service divine, very pleasant and helpful. Shower pressure - amazing! Close walk to shops, Tokyo station (10mins walk). Recommend this hotel for your stay in Ginza.

The positive things about staying at the Mercure Tokyo Ginza are its location and its staff. The hotel, a small hotel located on a side street in Ginza, is close to the major department stores, luxury goods stores, walking distance to the Tokyo train station, the Imperial East Garden, and the Tsukiji Fish Market. The reception staff speak English and are very helpful. That said, the rooms are very small (even by European standards) and, because they are so small, the walls are stained/dirty with the comings and goings of the guests and their luggage. It desperately needs a coat of paint in the rooms (we saw three and they were all the same). The bathroom is of average size and the air conditioning works beautifully. The internet connection was very poor in the rooms but with good speed in the reception area.
user_name:
Telsie A
San Juan, Puerto Rico

review_body: Down a small lane so and no huge frontage or reception. Rooms small but ok by Japanese standards. 15 min walk from Tokyo Central train station. Surrounded by shops etc.Perfectly fine option for this part of Tokyo.

The hotel is situated strategically in the heart of Tokyo city, very close to the train and subway station, and right next to the Ginza shopping district. Hundreds of restaurants, shopping malls, convenience stores and the likes, so everything is right around the corner.Rooms are a bit small but that's true for any city-center hotel anywhere in the world. Great connectivity with wifi.Breakfast spread is very limited. Mostly continental affair, but the options are very few, and the menu doesn't change much on a day to day basis. This is not a problem however as there are many restaurants in the vicinity.Not far from Haneda airport either, about £50 by taxi one way or one could take the mono-rail. B mindful it is indeed quite some distance from Narita. Hotel runs a shared shuttle service to Tokyo NRT airport for about £25 or so.Excellent staff, very cooperative. If breakfast is not included in your booking, remember to get a discount voucher of 10% from the reception for the breakfast.Will stay here again, and definitely recommended.

This hotel has an excellent location and has direct access to subway Ginza-itchome line Y which is very handy. Staff people are extremely kind and helpful always ready to provide you the best experience on your stay! Accommodations are good and make a great value for money. Recommended !

The hotel was great for shopping. All the stores were a five minute walk. The subway and train were about six minutes away. The hotel and restaurant staff were incredibly helpful. The restaurant got me gluten-free bread and the chef spoke with me to make sure I had a safe gluten-free dinner. McDonalds is two minutes away if you have children.
user_name:
Nancy882
Victoria Capital Regional District, Canada

review_body: The rooms are not as small as other hotel rooms in Tokyo.Great location, near muji and metroThe reception when checking in was fast, but they need a better person that speaks English when a problem arises. We were accommodated when we had a problem after the person talking to us called their manager. But overall it was a good stay.The breakfast buffet, I don't know why they would not allow someone wearing room slip ons. When Its not a formal looking restaurant.

The Mercure Tokyo Ginza has a great location - within easy walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Imperial Theater, the famous Ginza Street, the Tokyo Ginza subway stations, the Kabukiza Theater, and Tsukiji Fish Market. Just across the street are numerous convenience stores, restaurants and bars.The breakfast buffet was very good, there was a wide variety of western and Asian foods available, everything was really tasty. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel, so cannot comment on these meals at the hotel's (only) restaurant.Their front desk staff was always helpful and professional, and spoke fluent English, French, German, Mandarin, and of course Japanese. The only downside was the small room that we had, it was spacious enough for 2 twin beds, but only barely had enough rooms for our suitcases. However, the room was spotlessly clean, and was maintained at a very high level of cleanliness every day. Overall, a very good hotel, with a wonderful central location, and knowledgeable and helpful staff.

We were lucky enough to stay in this hotel which we highly recommend if you can afford it. Located in the heart of Ginza (the “5th Avenue of Tokyo”), with direct access from the elevator to the metro station, great breakfast with both Japanese and European buffet, clean large rooms, and most important of all: great staff that speaks different languages and always ready to help you with a smile.

This average Mercure is centrally located in Ginza, not too far from the Ginza Itchome Metro station.The hotel feels cramped from the minute you enter the building and take the elevator to the lobby.Thankfully, we only spent a single night at the hotel.We booked a Superior room, partially paying with points and got exactly that, regardless of our Platinum status.Check-in was rather quick, although zero explanations regarding the hotel's services were given.The receptionist also gave us 2 cans of juice, as a welcome gift.Our room (1112) was rather small, with no view whatsoever and featured a tiny TV and a small bathroom with bath tub (no shower).The bathroom amenities were the regular Mercure brand, and despite being very cheap, we like their apple scent.Walls are probably thin (or there's an insulation problem), because we could hear everything in the next room (yes, including everything...).Having said that, the beds were rather comfy.Thankfully, we did not have breakfast at the hotel and you really ought to avoid it, as it's a long wait. Simply try one of the numerous cafés nearby.Bottom line – as long as you don't get your expectations too high, you can enjoy a decent (yet unremarkable) 3-star hotel in the middle of Ginza.

When we first arrived in Tokyo we were tired, hot and grumpy. After a two day journey and lugging suitcases up and down stairs and on and off trains were finally arrived at the Mercure hotel 2 1/2 hours before check in time. The extremely friendly staff got us right into our room which was a wonderful relief. The room was very clean and comfy. We had a double bed room, the room was small but that is what you get in Tokyo so don't expect more for a good price. The room was cleaned nicely everyday when we came back from our activities. When we checked in we received 10% off coupons for the breakfast buffet to use each morning of our stay. That was appreciated. The buffet with the coupon costs about 2000 yen per person and offers a good selection of both American and Japanese foods and the staff is very quick to clear your empty dishes. The breakfast is charged to your room and you pay upon checkout. I would also like to add that the entire staff was very accommodating when it came to speaking English with us. We can only speak some Japanese. The staff that we encountered spoke English very well which alleviated some stress. Another added bonus is that the basement level of the hotel leads directly to the subway. You can take the elevator directly down into it! That was a huge relief after multiple hours or walking. All in all I would definitely stay here again if I ever had the opportunity and would recommend others to do the same.

Since we were a family of 14 who travelled to Tokyo, I booked 5 rooms at Mercure Tokyo Ginza. 3 rooms were on the 11th floor while the other 2 rooms were at the 12th. All 3 rooms at the 11th floor were uncomfortably hot, as if there was no a/c. On our 2nd day, we reported the hot temp of the a/c and they said that they will check on the a/c. The 3rd night became even worse, I had to take a photo of the a/c display which showed error. I had to switch the aircon on and off for it to work since it stopped working when the inverted E appeared. The following day, I showed the photo of the aircon display to the person at the front desk and requested for a room change for our rooms which they graciously did. It was only on the 4th and 5th night that we slept comfortably in our rooms. The room and bathroom were clean and kept tidy during our stay. Pillows were kind of flat. There were good restaurants in the area. The staff at the reception were approachable and were helpful in giving directions to go to different places around the city. I hope that they do something about the a/c on the 11th floor. Tourists usually are tired from all the walking and shopping and a comfortable sleep is a needed to recharge for the following day.

Am a platinum Accor member and certainly didn't get treated like one the 3 nights I stayed there.-am entitled to an upgrade and was given a room with twin beds - why would a solo traveler need twin beds? The manager rudely argued that it was a bigger room .... Right, where the unused 2nd twin bed takes up the additional space. Anyway they didn't manage to honour by providing a twin bed. -when I entered the (twin) room which I was upgraded to, there was some rubbish (looked like food waste) on the floor. I went to show the manager reception. He was too occupied making small talk with visitors from his country (conversing in Spanish) and asked not to be disturbed when there was a disappointed customer patiently waiting for 5 minutes 3 metres away to speak with him. Completely disrespectful!-room was pretty standard for Japan-breakfast was basic with a lot of processed foods, a bit lower standard than most mercures I've been to-location is fantastic smack bang in the middle of ginza. Can walk to the fish market, to the shopping and business areas

We have just returned after another enjoyable stay at the Mercure Tokyo Ginza Hotel. If you are after a good hotel with a family friendly feel to it and right in the heart of Tokyo … this is it!The rooms are a good size for Tokyo, provides all the usual amenities, has large windows giving plenty of light in the room, is very clean and the beds are really comfortable. It is a quiet hotel located in a safe area to walk around, be it day or night.The dining room is intimate - the staff are very friendly and efficient, and a great source of information. The breakfast buffet has a good balance of eastern and western choices, the lunch is a buffet and provides the option to choose from a lighter smaller selection or to have access to the full buffet, the dinner menu is French focused and offers an excellent selection - our tip for dinner, consider choosing from the specials of the day - there is one in each category of food, they are very reasonable (1,000 to 1,800 yen), freshly prepared and all delicious. The chef regularly comes out to chat to his evening diners and enquire how they are enjoying their meal. There is a small bar and coffee area annexed to the dining area.The General Manager, Kamel Senhadji, is to be commended for the quality of his team and the excellent service they provide to guests. Mr Senhadji introduced himself to us and we found him to be very amicable and genuinely interested in hearing our views relating to the hotel. If you have even the slightest problem or a request, his staff ensure that it is addressed immediately.Javier Piqueres Fayos and all of the reception staff are extremely obliging and will provide you with maps and information to get you to your intended destination. We found the best ‘go to’ information they provided was contained in the hotel vicinity map, the coloured subway map and the Tokyo Handy Guide - don’t leave the hotel without them. The hotel is close to three subway stations - Ginza Station (exit A13) was our regular – and we strongly recommend using the subway system and also buying a Pasmo or Suica prepaid transportation card. The nearby subway system provides easy access to all major tourist attractions in Tokyo.This hotel is so convenient – it is only several minutes from the main Ginza shopping street, where you are spoilt for shopping choices and you can shop at the original and biggest Uniqlo store in the world. The ornate Ginza Kabukiza Theatre, the Imperial Palace and the Tsukiji Fish Market & outer market are must see attractions and within walking distance from the hotel.If you exit the hotel and go right - there is a McDonalds at the corner, a Lawson store directly across the road from the corner, turn right and there is a Starbucks just down on the left. Then a little further on the right are a St Marc Café and a Douter Café, both good to pick up a quick beverage / snack. If you exit the hotel and go left - there is a Family Mart and a small Douter Café near the corner.The basement levels of the Matsuya and Mitsukoshi Department Stores which are both close by, have an extensive selection of reasonably priced take away food – such as sandwiches, a wide variety of hot food, cakes, pastries, grocery items, alcohol and … the list goes on. There are also many small eateries and restaurants close by and reception will provide you with a recommendation list they have compiled – however make sure you try the hotel dining room, it is very reasonable and has excellent meals.Tip - Japanese politely queue for EVERYTHING ... so don’t queue jump - even on a platform when you are waiting for a train.

We have stayed at Mercure Tokyo Ginza during our visit to the city with family for a holiday in 2015 April, high season for Japan, thanks to the cherry blossoms. Mercure was a great find with very friendly staff and attentive general manager making sure that made sure he made contact with the guests to make sure of their satisfaction. The rooms were quite spacious (for Tokyo) and equipped for the room price we had to pay. Getting to places around the town is a breeze and there is plenty to enjoy walking distance from the hotel.

Location is the best part, short walking to all shoppings and the popular Ginza Street, plenty of restaurants around. A small grocery store 2 min walk from hotel in case needed something. However, for the high price they charge the least they can provide is an included breakfast, so disappointing that No breakfast included with that expensive deal $250 per night stay. (Booked online)

I come here rather regularly on business. There simply is no better value for money in downtown Tokyo.Best-possible location in Ginza.Great for business travelers with subway and JR connections close by.Great for shoppers as almost any shops, malls or boutiques are within walking distance.Wonderful staff - endlessly patient, helpful and attentive.What else could you ask for?!

Located in the one of the most expensive places on earth, this hotel is reasonably priced, if a little tired.Short walk (within 10 minutes from Ginza and Marunouchi subway lines, directly above entrance to Yurakucho line station. Rooms pretty standard sized for Tokyo hotel (not big, but not cramped), our room was tired looking, but clean.Close to shopping, many restaurants also within easy walk distance.Free in room Wi-Fi.

We have just returned from a great holiday spent in a lovely hotel and in a wonderful location. To say that we were impressed with the place is an understatement - be it the service or the cleanliness everything was absolutely superb. The staff, all of whom were great ambassadors for the hotel, were helpful, courteous and friendly.Everywhere was kept exceptionally clean. Our room was spotless, housekeeping second to none. The room was on the top floor, very quite part of the hotel.Our bed was huge and very comfortable. The wi-fi service was intermittent so I had to renew the lease every time I changed website. That aside, I cannot praise the Mercure Ginza highly enough. We will definitely return.
