Location of the hotel is good as train station is just below the hotel and other metro connection stations are ~5min walk away. Many restaurants can be found around the area and shopping malls are few minutes walk away. Breakfast is fine. Room are simple and a bit small which leave little space for luggage but it is clean and bed is comfortable. The price of the hotel is a bit steep in comparison to other similar category hotel but nevertheless I am quite satisfied with my stay.

Hotel is right in the middle of Ginza district. Shopping is really close by. Subway access is in basement of hotel or a 2 block walk to 3 intersecting lines. No need for taxi's,,,subway is very user friendly. Plenty of nearby places to eat. Hotel staff extremely polite and helpful.

This hotel is in a convenient position but when we booked we specified a room with a walk in shower not over the bath as we are older and find it difficult to climb into the bath and were there for five nights. When we checked in we were told they only had rooms with a bath. We should have been notified of this when we booked as it may have meant we were unable to have a shower for five days. When we checked was too late to book elsewhere. To make it worse the bathroom was a step up from the main room ,a real danger at night. We would have upgraded the room if that gave us a safer room but this was not an option. This is just a warning for older travellers who are not that agile.

This was a nice surprise as right off the bat when we checked-in the clerk gave us tremendous amount of information on things to do and transportation. The room was nice, actually bigger than rooms we had had elsewhere in Asia. The hotel is directly linked to the subway and it makes it easy to visit various areas of the city. We didnt eat at the hotel as they are many places around it, including a nice typical ramen Japanese-style restaurant just around the corner.

This hotel lies in the district of Ginza and is more expensive. I enjoyed the room with a more modern feel to it. It is near Sony, Apple Store, Kabuki-za Theater, and museums as well. The breakfast was ok.

Even before we left home we were impressed by service from the Mercure Ginza in supplying local area map, Japanese taxi card and directions from hotel . On arrival Checkin was efficient and we were quickly in our room on seventh floor. Room was surprisingly good size given what we had heard about Japanese hotels and we had no issue with cleanliness. We enjoyed buffet breakfast on both mornings of our stay and had one dinner in the in- house restaurant which was of good quality and served by attentive staff. Hotel is very close to metro and Ginza shopping area. Would stay here again.

What we like most is the location.The hotel's location is perfect for our family trip this time. Since we come as big family with kids. Our main destinations are mainly for kids; Ueno Park, Disneyland and Toy park, Ginza. From hotel just walking distance to Toy park and 4-5 main department stores just around the corners. It's easy to take subway from Ginza station (just two block away from hotel) to Ueno station only 11 minutes direct route. From the hotel's basement there is Ginza-itchome station that we can take the yellow line to Shin-Kiba JR station and change to Pink line to Maihama station which is connected to the disney resort station, this route take only 30 minutes.Hotel service is good and meet international standard, the receptionists are so helpful, polite and friendly, always willing to assist us. Though I found this hotel is very popular to international guests in particular Asian guests. The hotel's staffs are quite busy everyday.The room is in good condition and clean, enough space for parents with small kid. Breakfast is fine not much but not less. Next time to Tokyo I will consider to stay in this hotel again or try other hotels around this area as I like the location a lot.

The staff as always most abliging. Cant do enough for you. This time I have been able to enjoy dinner and set meals. Just amazing.Of course the location of the hotel is fantastic hence why I persevered with it.Worth the detour.

The mercure was a great place to stay the staff were lovely and helpful as most Japanese are with service, there was an ice machine located next to our room which was convenient for a night cap, the room held all the necessities and amenities required for hotel stay and although was in the expensive part of town is located 10 mins walk to tokyo central station and 5 mins from the nxt station (cant remember th e name sorry) and the mercure sits directly above a subway station with a McDonald's ground floor and starbucks across the road!

More than we expect.As we are traveling for our first trip to Tokyo, we contact the Hotel staff for some information about the city, transportation and restaurant reservations. We were gently answered by the Hotel manager and assistent, giving us more than just options but a special and warm welcome in Japan. The hotel itself is very confortable and adjusted to our expectatives. The room seems to be bigger than the city average. The localization is a must for who wants to explore Ginza region. To complete our opnion about the property, even when we left the hotel to explore other cities and unfortunately had left a personal belongs we had a prompt and efficient response from the lost and founds staff. We could say they had a five star service and surely recommend.

Perfectly positioned for seeing Tokyo and close to all the shops in Ginza. Rooms are adequate and clean with a nice sized bathroom. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was very limited for western tastes.

The hotel has a great location and walkable to the main shopping areas, Tokyo station and the fish markets. Rooms were small, but very clean and with all the amenities you need. Breakfast was excellent with a great mix of western and Japanese options. The hotel also arranged the takuhaibin for us to forward our luggage to Osaka. The great staff really made this hotel; helpful, welcoming and friendly. Even the cleaning staff made the effort to be really welcoming and lovely. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Room rather small to me, but is clean and neat. They provides what I need during my stay. Breakfast ok. But we like the Japanese restaurant directly opposite the hotel main entrance. Great location and can have plenty of shopping at Ginza and many foods toHunt. Very near-20 mins to haneda airport

Our first trip to Tokyo and found this to be an excellent base to tour around Tokyo. The smart Ginza area is a short two minute walk. Access to the subway system under the hotel is helpful and the more connected Ginza line another short walk away. Taxi from Tokyo Station cost 1000Yen. The hotel staff as others have said are very courteous and helped us a great deal with directions around the city. Our room was comfortable and clean and we had a good sized room. Breakfast was varied and plentiful and a choice between western and Japanese. Scrambled eggs were done very well but bacon and sausages not so good. But that was the same everywhere we went. We both enjoyed the breakfasts. We would stay here again.
user_name:
NUTUK23
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is within easy distance of the limousine bus drop-off. Reception is on the first floor and the formalities were dealt with quickly and efficiently by friendly staff.The room was small, but that's pretty standard for Japan. Everything was in good condition and working - good bed with quality linen, well-equipped bathroom with shower over the bath and plenty of towels.Breakfast was extra, but decided to buy croissants, etc from the convenience store, Lawson, on the next corner. For those who like it, there's a 24 hour McDonalds on the same block as the hotel.The Wi-Fi is free with a consistent and strong signal.The hotel is on top of the subway, with direct access to Ginza-itchome station from the basement lift.All in all a good choice as a base for touring.Only two small niggles. The hotel's website mentions the subway underneath, but not which station. I emailed them to find out so I could plan my arrival, but no response. The other little thing is that they charge 30yen to print a page from email. Surely an hotel in such a world-wide chain could stand, say, five pages per guest as a service?

Stayed for 4 nights at end of April 2015. On arrival met by pleasant, courteous and helpful staff. Pleasantly surprised with the size of the room. Bathroom actually having a bath!, even if it was on the short size. Ideal location for shopping and there is a metro station that can be accessed via the basement of the hotel. On arrival our room wasn't ready so our bags were held and we were given a map to explore the local area. Breakfast was a good mix of western/asian. We did try the restaurant for an evening meal but was slightly disappointed with the quality/quantity/price.

Have now stayed here twice in the past 3 years and have enjoyed the experience both times. Great location - near to the major Ginza shops, restaurants and trains although may be challenging to find if you are on foot as its down a small laneway (which makes it very quick when sleeping!). If you want McDonalds its right next door although there are many other great food eats nearby. Staff are always very courteous and helpful. Haven't had the opportunity to eat there yet as I usually arrive late when restaurant closed for dinner and have been out travelling during the day. Rooms - Japanese size ie not too big but not too small. Has all the essential requirements and lovely toiletries.

Was happily surprised at the size of the rooms and the perfect location. Understood hotel rooms in Tokyo are generally very small but this one has rooms similar to western hotels. Right in the heart of Ginza, it is very easy to navigate around using the subway/underground or just on foot. There are some amazing shops and nice restaurants & cafes around here too. Most staff have good English and are very helpful and friendly, as are all the locals. Breakfast was available and very nice. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Walking around late at night, felt very safe in the neighbourhood.

Mercure Hotel, Tokyo, GinzaRoom was smartly presented and spacious as far as hotel room s go.I would give this one 4 stars.The staff were polite and courteous. The bed was comfortable and the shower was excellent, even though it was over the bath. The mirror had a warmed panel that did not mist over when showering. The toilet. What can I say. It had a warmed seat. It was a bidet and even had a function that washed your bottom. Of course your are visiting the land that invented gadgets. Location was in a good part of Tokyo. The Ginza district. Close to Shops, the subway and restaurants. Even a McDonalds in the same street and a Starbucks around the corner. For the shopper there is Celine and Cartier nearby.The reception area is on the 2nd level and is a bit small when a lot of people are trying to checkin and out. They have a lockup for your luggage should you get there early. Checkout time is 11:00am. Narita airport is about 1 hours drive from Tokyo. Taxis are a very expensive option. I used the T-CAT Airport Limousine bus cost JPY 1900 about AUD $20 each and they will take 2 pieces of luggage each.

Stayed at this hotel following cruise from Singapore. Rooms a bit dated but comfortable and relaxing. Hotel has no porter service so its self-service as regards getting your luggage to and from your room but its no real problem.Hotel is ideally situated for shopping on the Ginza which is only round the corner.There is a McDonalds round the corner but the hotel restaurant has reasonably good food at an acceptable price. Beer is expensive but no more so than in any other major city.

Spent three nights at this hotel. We stayed on the 7th floor in a room far from the lift. Room was small but comfortable. If you wanted a little more room then an upgrade was available for a fee. Food in the restaurant was basic but adequate.All staff were extremely polite as are most people in Japan.It was great to have free and fast wifi in the room.. Would definitely recommend.

Though a bit small with a super small lobby, this hotel is conveniently located in a quiet street within Ginza, The metro station and two other subway stations are within 5 to 10 minutes walk away. A 24-hour McD outlet and Lawson convenient store can be found around the corner from the hotel, making it very convenient for visitors looking for an early morning or midnight snacks. Glitzy retail outlets, high-end departmental stores and other small restaurants and cafes are all within walking distance and just a few blocks away. Hotel staff are efficient, freindly and well versed in English. We had a very pleasant stay in this small cozy establishment!

We had a fabulous stay at the Mercure Ginza. Yes, the rooms are somewhat small (typical of Japan), but all the amenities & little extras one expects these days are provided. Wifi service is excellent. The rooms are spotless. And then there's the staff. Wow - they were all so impressive in every possible way. Could not fault them. In all, we stayed 5 nights there and when next in Tokyo, we will stay there again. We also loved the location. We dined in the (French/Italian) restaurant downstairs and would highly recommend it, particularly if you return from a long day of sightseeing, feeling disinclined to walk any more that day and fancying a European style meal for a change - you can't go wrong. The service and quality of the cuisine are excellent. Great wine list too!

This is the best location possible in Ginza. All the great shopping stores are at a short walking distance and the staff is very welcoming. The lobby staff made everything possible to help us have a great stay in Tokyo. They called the taxis for us, helped us with directions and gave us important advice.

Booked for 4 nights. Very helpful English speaking staff. Staff were willing to help with directions to the subway and to Daytrip collection points. Nothing seemed a problem. Would recommend this Hotel. Room was a bit small, but this seems to be usual around Japan. Subway was close and easily to travel on. Most of the shops were in walking distance. As we were not leaving until late in the day, they offered to store our bags while we went shopping and collected them before we left.

Very friendly staff. Some are fluent in English. Include Breakfast when booking. We purchased a 3 day subway pass which was a great move. Got around very easily. Another very useful idea was to order a pocket WiFi through Pupuru that we picked up at Narita. Even received a clear voice call over WiFi when on a subway.

This hotel was perfectly located in Ginza just around the corner from some amazing shopping experiences. The Metro line below the hotel was a bonus, as was the fifteen min walk to Tokyo station or if you needed only 730 yen by taxi. The rooms were spotless the beds very comfortable. The hotel was whisper quiet, we were on the 6 th floor. The staff at reception couldn't do enough for us when we needed help. The staff in the restaurant were so attentive and the food amazing and such great value for money. We will be back same time in two years without a doubt. Unless we are lucky enough to come sooner.

The location is perfect (ginza) and the rooms are small basic but very clean and tidy. Avoid peak times at reception as there are queues. The breakfast is also really busy at times but is an excellent buffet with a good selection of Japanese and western food.The Internet is slow and when checking in there is no recognition of Accor membership benefits offered to us.

Very good location in Ginza, closed to shopping malls, underground, etc.Rooms are small but fairly clean.Staff is very helpful and friendly specially the assistant manager.The bar closes to early and breakfast is a bit overprice for what it is.

Small hotel but strategically located in Ginza. It's a 15min walk to Tsukiji for great sushi. 5min walk to the metro with lines that bring you directly to Shibuya, Shinjuku, Asakusa and Ueno. I really dreaded subway line changes in Tokyo so this was really great. The Ginza area also has some really good restaurants.Staff were excellent and so helpful. We needed to make a reservation in the morning and as the restaurant was not yet open, the receptionist kindly said she will call and then inform me via email. I was not completely confident that she will remember but she definitely did follow up for me and by the afternoon I'd received an email confirmation that the reservation was made. Thank you, Haruka Fukushima! For where it's located, this place was definitely value for money.

Great hotel to base yourself for exploring Tokyo & Ginza areas, with one train station accessible from level B1 in the hotel and a another 10mins walk.The deluxe room is a good size for spending a week here & the restaurant menu had enough variation to enjoy eating in each night if you don't feel like going out again after a long day wandering the city.This hotel is exceptional value for Accor Advantage Plus members.

We stayed at the Merure Tokyo Ginza for two insights.the staff were very helpful and booked restaurants for us. It is in. Good location close to the Ginza shopping area and the fish markets. Lots of good restaurants close by. Rooms are small but large compared to other hotels in Japan. Reasonable rates.

Stayed one night at this hotel in central Tokyo, Ginza district. The hotel is situated very close to the Tokyo station, only takes about 10-15 min to walk. It is also situated right over a subway station, so it is very easy to get around in the city from the hotel. the staff was very friendly and gave advice of where to go shopping, eating, sightseeing and so on. The rooms were not too big, but still met my expectations considering the price and the location in the middle of Tokyo. The breakfast was ok, but a bit expensive. If you like luxury shopping you have lots of nice brand stores just around the corner.

We spent one night here. Nice location. Lovely staff, so friendly and very helpful. Rooms a little larger than I expected and well appointed with good bathroom. My low star rating is due to the cost...Our room was €300 for the night but it wasn't worth that. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting.

Although only rated at three stars, the Mercure in Ginza isn't lacking in anything other than a swimming pool and gym. The buffet is fresh daily, and the rooms are well kept, with all the amenities you expect from an Accor Hotel. Importantly, it is within walking distance to the centre of Ginza and surrounded by bars, restaurants and shops. I would highly recommend and intend on returning.

This hotel is in Ginza which is a nicer "fancy" shopping district, which means the surrounding area is well taken care of.The hotel itself is easy to find thanks to signage at either end of it's street.The room was quite large for tokyo standards and I found I had plenty of room.The closet is small for two people but we expected that and just lived out of our suitcases.Room and Bathroom are both clean and well designed, no issues at all.We didnt try the food onsite but it seems to lean toward a French theme.The only issue I had was the AC is a little warm, and slow to cool the room.The minimum coolnes I could set it to is 20 and it never felt as though the room got there even though I had it running for 10 days straight.

Hotel is located at a silence district, just 5 mins from subway station and 10 mins from JR station on foot. Many small traditional restaurants and convenience store nearby. Hotel is a very narrow shape building, no prominent entrance and reception lobby on 2/F. Lobby is small, front desk staffs are nice, helpful and good English speaking. It is very efficiency to complete the check-in process and go to room.Guest room is international standard double bed room but decoration is old-fashioned. All amenities are function with good maintenance. No attraction view from window. Wifi is available in guest room.Breakfast is no good, less items selection and no change in two days.Conclusion is average because I have higher expectation with the brand of Accor. Promotion price attract me to stay here. I suggest guest rooms need renovation with modern design.

Comfotable, neat clean hotel, with very attentive staff. Staff go out of their way to be attentive. Assistant manager brilliant. Fabulous central position. Walking distance to Tsukiji markets, shopping restaurants and train station accessable from lower level.

Right in Ginza a short walk to everything, this friendly, clean and pleasant hotel met all our group's needs, from newspapers in the morning to directions and advice whenever needed. You can take the elevator to the lower level and a short internal walk to the train line.

Recently stayed at the Mercure hotel in Ginza for a family wedding;We have never been to Japan and found it quite an adventure. The staff at the hotel are excellent, they are helpful, friendly and really try to make your stay outstanding. We have to make special mention of the Assistant Manager Javier Fayos and Miki at the front desk. Javier went out of his way to help us finding us reservations at restaurants on a busy Friday night. The location of the hotel is great; walking distance to subway stations, great shopping and lots of great food. Like many places in Japan, things do close down early by western standards. The restaurant/lounge in the hotel stops serving drinks at 10:00 PM; This is the only downside from my perspective but I am sure it is a cultural difference rather than a policy issue with the hotel. Most places don't open until 10:00 or 11:00 and are closed no later than 11:00. The rooms are small by western standards, but are clean functional and quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel for any traveler to the Ginza area of Tokyo.

The room in this hotel is very clean. There are Ginza and Kabukiza Theater near the hotel. There is also a riverside fish market in Tsukiji near the hotel. Staff at the hotel restaurant can speak easy English.

A practical hotel as convenient as you like for all Tokyo activities. Sub 5 min walk from Higashi-Ginza which has a direct train to Haneda airport. The main Ginza shopping street is only 50 metres away. Great choice of restaurants of all cuisines and price brackets all around.The rooms are compact (as you would expect for this budget in central Tokyo) but well designed and furnished. Free Wi-Fi with a decent strength signal in the rooms.The staff are very helpful with a decidedly French flavour. We had just been staying in a traditional Japanese hotel where everyone wears the supplied kimonos and slippers for meals. My wife, ill-advisedly, decided to wear the hotel slippers to breakfast at the Mercure. Monsieur le restaurant manager sent her packing back to the room to put on proper shoes before she was allowed to into his salon :-) Very funny, very French.Of the three hotels I have stayed in this area I would definitely say this is the best.

Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Location was great as it was close to local subway, walking distance to tokyo station & the shopping district. On out visit to Tokyo we discovered that not much is open on a Sunday night for dinner, so we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant- one of the best pasta dishes I've ever eating. Rooms were clean & quite spacious.

Convenient location in Ginza. It is also walking distance to Tokyo Station. Staff members are courteous and accommodative. I had breakfasts there for several days and can attest to the food quality there.

Excellent stay (My stay in mid Jan 2015), warm and very helpful front desk (escorted by FOM to room which is my first time), clean, big and tidy room. Absolutely children friendly (my kid is 5). Staff can speak fluent English .Well done for the front desk and restaurant manager.Although the wifi is free, it is a bit slow for me. I do suggest to bring your own portable wifi when travel in Japan. 1st Choice to stay in Tokyo if not too pricey.

I stayed four nights at the Mercure. I used nearly all services and I have been very satisfied with all of them. Room is large (which is good in Tokyo), clean, really clean, bed is confortable. Air conditioning not noisy. Restaurant at the hotel is very good and at reasonable prices. Breakfast is OK. Cleaning service is excellent. The staff is at the top: helpful, smiling and polite. Hotel is well located close to shopping, restaurant, metro an Tokyo station. I recommend this hotel.

Ginza was actually quite a nice place to stay, not as crowded as Shinjuku/Shibuya etc. and the Mercure is maybe about 2 streets/blocks away from the main strip of the Ginza branded store. It was 2 mins walk to Chanel and Matsuya department store with all the LV/Fendi etc. Rooms are decent, small but it's Tokyo. You shower in the bathtub which is quite small. Bed is comfy. Their reception is on the 2nd level, so when you get there, it's just a set of lifts, and they don't have porters to help you with luggages. But the receiptionist girl was really nice and took a trolley down and delivered everything to our room and refused a tip. A 24 hours maccas is at the corner of the block, and there's also family mart close by the hotel for drinks and snacks and there's an entrance to the Tokyo metro line via the hotel lift, even though we never took it. We also walked to the Tsukiji market from there, about 20mins walk. If you want to catch a limosine bus to the airport, you can catch it from Courtyard Marriott which is about 4mins taxi drive from Mercure. Courtyard Marriott was the closest pick up point from Mercure for the buses to the airport. So we stuffed our luggages into the taxi and he drove us there for about 1,100 yen, instead of dragging our luggages there. Bus was 930 yen per person to Haneda. Pick-up time is quite limited so check limousinebus.co.jp. We tought buses to be easiest way to get to airport because we had 3 big suitcases and 2 cabin luggages. Taxi from Haneda to Hilton Tokyo Shinjuku (our previous hotel) cost us ~12,000 yen.

This hotel is positioned right in the centre of Ginza close to all the shops, bars and restaurants. The Hotel has access below ground to the train station so it makes it so easy to get around.The hotel rooms are small (standard for Tokyo) but are pleasant enough. The mattresses are a little hard.The staff are great and will help you out with any questions you may have about the city and where to eat, etc....The Breakfast is also really great and they have everything to fill you up before starting your day in Tokyo.Wifi is not that good, especially if you are in a room at the end of the floor ! WIFI hardly works

We had a pleasnt two night stay but were surprised with the compact size of the room compared to other hotels we had used whilst in Japan - however, we had heard that Ginza was not known for it's space vs price ratio but it needed to be seen to be believed. Had I written this review a few days earlier it may have been more scathing as the lack of space led to what I thought was a broken toe when trying to access the bathroom while navigating the narrow path between the bed and our luggage...but I thankfully seem to have escaped with just severe bruising and soreness and can write nice things!! The location is fantastic. Quick and easy access to a Ginza station and the shopping street. A short walk to the fantastic Yurakucho restaurant strip under the rail tracks (definitely check out the delicious BBQ tongue restaurant!). A bit further on and still only a 20min walk to Tokyo station and the Marunouchi area. Finally we were also stoked to be within a very short walk to the Imperial Palace grounds and the fish market. All staff spoke fantastic English - the best of each hotel we stayed out during our trip. The Manager in particular was extremely helpful with guidance to get places and other helpful advice. Wifi connections were fantastic and the room was lovely and quiet. Our only other negative comment would be that we found it hard to regulate the temperature. Often it got too hot and we had to turn on the a/c to cool it down. Room size could be a factor, especially when the shower was used and more heat was generated. Overall we enjoyed our stay and recommend this hotel to others.

This hotel is well placed, it's only a 2-3 minute walk to the main Ginza shopping district, a 15 minute walk to Tokyo station & easy access to all the Metro lines. The staff are very helpful & pleasant, they speak good English too. Rooms are large by Tokyo standards & well equipped. A good location & a quality lowish cost option for Tokyo centre.

The location of this hotel is perfect. There is a direct access from Ginza-Itchome subway and less than 10 minutes walking from JR Yurakucho station. I arrived before the check in time and the room was ready for early check in. The staff at the reception is very efficient too.The only issue I've found was noises from the room next door. My room has a connecting door. A (Chinese) couple stay next door. As I am writing this, they are in the middle of having a very loud argument and I am really annoyed. Given the perfect location, I will consider this hotel next time. But, I might request a room with no connecting door if possible, so I won't be disturbed with the noises from next door.

We could only stay for 1 night at the Mercure Ginza. What a great Hotel! From checking to checking out the experience was great. The French Manager and his staff at the from desk not only presented well but were very friendly. My 3.5 year old daughter we treated like a princess, she received a small gift and candy, very happy!The location is very good with easy access to the subway, shopping and restaurants. I have been told to avoid Ginza , now however this will be my hotel choice when in Tokyo.

We stayed here for one night on the way to start a walking holiday. We booked it as a 3 star hotel and paid 3 star prices. We were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were fantastic, both at reception and in the dining room. They helped us book luggage transfers, taxi's to the train station and with ordering vegetarian food. The room was newly appointed, although relatively small (but better than we expected). The restaurant has a limited menu, but it was fine for us, and we were able to find a starbucks for coffee within 200m, and many restaurants nearby. We would stay here again. Our overall rating reflects the fact that we think this is great value and service for a 3 star hotel in a major city.

This is the first time we have stayed at this hotel. As an Accor Member we booked the hotel through the Accor Booking system. What a great find. It has been 16 years since my wife and I last visited Tokyo. The hotel was close to everything. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of heaps of attractions including Tokyo Rail Station and the Imperial Palace. Fantastic Japanese restaurants were very close. My wife and I would particularly like to thank the Executive Chef and his staff for the great evening meals. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Their meal service was exceptional. We would also like to acknowledge the Assistant Front Officer Manager and his staff. If you required anything it was there and if they didn't know something they would go and find an answer for you. All the staff made you feel special.We only found one downside. The rooms are not quite as big as Australians are used to but ours was adequate. As for prices in Japan what an inexpensive place it is. The only thing that is expensive is transport apart from that meals etc. cost next to nothing compared to Australia.A great hotel, a great location, great staff, very clean I would recommend it to anyone. We will most definitely be staying here again if we return to Japan.

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The service was excellent on the previous occasion and even better this time. We spent 4 nights at the hotel. Obviously, the desk staff get asked the same questions regarding places to eat and transportation so they had prepared easy to read maps with this information for guests. The front desk staff and management were superb and could not have helped more. The only issue we had was that we couldn't get a rollaway bed. However, we were immediately upgraded to a room with two twin beds for the three of us. The room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was nice and tasty but a little mundane and could have been from any hotel anywhere in the world. But I assume that most guests are business people and this is what they prefer. The location is excellent and close to numerous restaurants and convenience stores. There is a McDonalds on the bottom floor which suited my 15 year old son when his parents tried more "exotic" food.My opinion is that the service we received at the Ginza Mercure should serve as model for every hotel We will definitely be returning.

When we booked this hotel via Expedia, we assumed our written requirements re one Queen bed & a rollaway would be understood. When we got to our room, we only had a Queen bed. But very quickly after explaining our requirements, they moved us to a twin room which suited well. Apparently, an entire Japanese family of 4 sleep in 1 queen sized bed in hotels.Buffet breakfast was deliciousConvenient location to shopping high end brands if your budget allows.Above a subway station for easy transport.Hotel staff provided a map of Japanese & Western restaurants which was a winner !A Tempura restaurant, an easy walk from Mercure - 3000 Yen for dinner for 3 with a wine & a beer

A good hotel with a good location.Staff with a good attitude that makes you feel helped and attended in the middle of hostility of Japanese kind-of-xenophobic attitude.It is located in a fancy place. You could arrive from the airport by taking a bus that will leave you few blocks away (at Courtyard Marriott hotel).You need to be very careful when asking for some address since people are not used to that, it is more easier to find both hotels by giving references (i. e. close to Bulgari store, close to Starbucks, etc.).If you travel for business or for giving away to luxury consumerism it is a good place to stay but consider that it is very quiet at weekend since there are no business activity.Otherwise, if your rather to stay in an different area with more day and night activity then you should try Shibuya district.Hotel amenities don’t have a Tokyo-standards quality, should be improved.Hotel (just as every Tokyo space) is very clean and comfortable.Public spaces should also be improved, specially corridors’ carpets since those are not in their best conditions and make really difficult to pull your luggage through it.A good choice should be to offer some transportation to Marriott hotel since there are many guests that take the bus there to Narita Airport.

Stayed in Mecure Tokyo Ginza for 1 night as we are going to Shiga Kogen for a week of skiing. Extremely convenient especially the Metro station is in the basement of the hotel.Enjoyed shopping in Ginza even if it is only 1 day. Lots of food places in the area. Breakfast in the hotel was good, have both Japanese and Continental breakfast including hot breakfast no shortage of choices.The reception staff were extremely helpful. Room was very comfortable and internet access was fast. Overall, I would stay here again.

Tokyo is expensive, but we thought the Mercure was a great choice. The rooms were secure and comfortable, and the hotel was easy to find. It's a short walk to transport. Lots of eating places just nearby. Our stay included buffet breakfast, which was delicious.

As an international brand you know what to expect in terms of service and quality of the room. The staff is very professional and the room is good. The best part is the location and what you pay for this. Considering you have a subway station just under the hotel and others on a short walking distance, you can easily reach any place in Tokyo. Beside this, you will find several cafes, restaurants, department stores in the area. So this is the place to stay in Tokyo without spending lots of money.

This hotel gets my vote for Tokyo every time. It definitely isn't a five star hotel but it's an extremely good three and a half star. It's well located in the shopping heart of Tokyo Ginza. Close to the Imperial Palace and accessible to most of Tokyo's hotspots its a useful starting point for daily tours of Tokyo and for any business meetings. The room was slightly small but big enough and reasonable by central Tokyo standards. It was clean. The facilities all worked. The bathroom had everything I needed. And there was no smoke smell. And it was very very good value. It's perhaps a little dated but this will be my Tokyo hotel of choice.

The hotel is located about 5 - 10 minutes taxi ride from Tokyo Main Station not far from the centre of Ginza. The check in was easy and the room quite small but not the smallest we've stayed in. We liked the location because it is just a few minutes walk to al lthe main shops in Ginza. There are small restaurants all over the place and McDonalds and convenience stores are really close by. Our room overlooked the street but the view was not interesting. The staff were very helpful and overall we had a nice stay. We really love the location of the hotel and would happily stay here again.

We loved our stay in the Ginza , great location for exploring fish market then Ginza for shopping then it was easy to get the train to haneda. Small room but interconnecting rooms was great for family x

We spent 5 nights in two interconnecting rooms.Had all the usual amenties you would expect, no view from the 3rd floor. Staff were very helpful with trains, luggage storage and assisting me to check in for a flight.I didn't use any of the dining facilities due to the cost factor, there was a Mc Donald's and Lawson mini mart only a minute walking from the entrance. Also for breakfast, we dined at Datour, which is 2 minutes walk away ( turn right when leaving the hotel entrance, go to first crossroad, there you will find Mc Donald's and Lawson's, turn right and walk about 30 meters and you will find 2 coffee shops next to each other ( across the road is a multistory stationary shop ) . If you stay on this street and keep walking you will end up at Yurakucho Station which is a JP Rail station, here you can ride the train on your pass for free. Also at this spot is a seven eleven store underground ( if you can find the Krispy Kreme donut shop, its in the same area, handy ATM for foreign cards )We could only find 2 English TV channels in the room ( BBC and a sport ) a little bit disappointing for this standard hotel.The other disappointment we had at this hotel was there policy of when your bill reach's 100000 yen, you must go and settle the bill. In our case, it happened on the 4th night of 5 night stay. It makes you feel like they don't trust you. We where not advised of this on check in!Its shame because it ruined a lovely stay in a nice hotel.I would still stay there again when I am in Tokyo, due to the handy location and friendly staff

Despite an unhappy experience over a booked accommodation in Taipei, I decided to give another try by booking Mercure Ginza during an Accor sale which came with complimentary brekkie. I checked in on the 3rd day of the new year and was given welcome gifts; reason being the welcoming of the new year. The size of the room impressed me as Japan hotel rooms are not known to be big. Toiletries were good but I didnt get the ladies' toiletries that was mentioned by some TA contributors. What is unusual about the bathroom is you need to take a step up to the bathroom. I missed the step one day coming out of the bathroom and fell onto the carpet flooring almost hitting my head against the wardrobe. There was the usual beverage making facility and they provided a good selection of green tea, English and strawberry tea. The hotel can be reached by taking the Yurakucho line to the Ginza itchome subway station which is directly below the hotel. During my stay, I took this line to avoid getting wet in the rain. Beware though the hotel entrance and exits of this line closed at 10 pm. As I walked through the station at 9.30 pm one evening, I saw several station masters patrolling the station which gave me a sense of uneasiness being the only passenger. It was as if the station was going to be locked down any moment. McDonald's is just next to the hotel by taking the lift down to the basement so if you ever feel hungry, it is open as late till 11 pm. Hotel card is required to operate the lift to the floor level of your room so there is some level of security assurance since the public can easily gain access to the hotel from the basement level and subway station level. Walking the streets of Ginza in the late night was exhilarating and very safe as one get to enjoy the New Year lightings with no crowds to bother you in picture taking. Despite the hotel being located in obviously a high class area with many couture brands being represented, it was sad to see an aged homeless man sleeping in the open near McDonald's huddled up with only an aluminium shield round his legs to protect him from the cold winter amidst his personal belongings. Throughout my three night stay at the hotel, this homeless man did not move a single step away from his makeshift home.There wasn't a wide selection of food served at breakfast but since it was complimentary, I am not complaining either. Despite signages at the lifts forewarning guests about the expectant queues at breakfast, I encountered crowds only one out of the three days I was there.It was overall a good comfortable stay and my perception of Accor service has changed that I booked a stay at the Hotel Ibis Bencoolen Singapore the following week. I will be making another trip and I won't be surprised if an Accor group of hotel will be my choice.

I had an overnight stay at Mecure Tokyo after a flight. You must know there doesn't have too much accor choices in Japan. I took a taxi from Haneda airport directly to the hotel because of late checkin and it's not on the main street. Surprisingly, I was upgraded to a large corner room maybe because of the accor platinum card. The street outside was quiet. The room was clean and comfortable. One point a little bit dispointed me is that the breakfast is not free even for accor platinum members. I may recommend the hotel to others.

Check in : I arrived quite late and was warmly greeted by the staffs. The check in process was very quick and effective. The staff was very helpful, and when she found out that this is my very first trip to Tokyo, she quickly provided me with subway map (proven to be very useful since I had meetings to attend the next morning on different area of Tokyo), surrounding map and important information of surrounding places. She also lend me umbrella the next day, knowing that the weather was a bit unfriendly.Room : The room was spacious for Japanese hotel standard, meticulously clean, the double beds were very comfortable and the amenities provided were on spot. It surprised me that they provided skin care as well (facial wash, facial milk, cleansing oil, face lotion) and was quite a relief since I forgot to bring mine to this trip. The closet is not that big, but usable. The hotel added a little extra touch by giving the green tea scented room and linen freshener as well. And , I got a room in ladies only alley as well ;)Food : Breakfast was okay, the variety of food is not as wide as any other mercure and/or M galleries I've been to, but the quality is superb. The breakfast place's capacity was a bit limited, but the hotel gave info (posted inside the elevator, if i'm not mistaken) on the timing for the most effective / less crowded breakfast.Location : Mercure Ginza was pleasantly located in the heart of Ginza, and has a direct access to one of the subway. It's a short walk to famous mall in Ginza as well.Misc : I had a small problem with my safety box, but the staff quickly resolved it the next day

Spent Christmas here on my honeymoon - we arrived very late forgetting that the trains stop at 12.We were warmly greeted and received a lovely bottle of wine as compliments. Our room was large compared to many we had in Japan. The bathroom was good and the bed was firm but very large and comfortable. As part of our deal we got lunch included and whilst the menu was small it was delicious with great salads and fresh breads. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the central Ginza shopping precinct with a couple of subway stations close by. Recommended.

Stayed here with the family for one night in January 2015. Very well located in Ginza close to shops and restaurants.We took the 'Access' bus to and from Narita. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes by foot from the Ginza stop.The breakfast had a good choice of food. Only one English (BBC) and one French channel on the Tv - all others in Japanese.Some other reviews about this hotel say that the rooms are too small. We didn't find that. We had two people in each room with a double bed and we certainly had enough room.We will definitely consider staying here if returning to Tokyo.

I have resubmit this review after getting correct name of the hotel staff from the hotel GM, thanks.This hotel is easily find by using google map and located nearby 3 train station in Ginza area. From Narita airport you could use bus also and arrive near Ginza station and just walk for 5 minutes to the Hotel. As in Ginza area, you could easily find many store and shopping center nearby. I am writing this review as We stay here with 3 kids. Initially we booked for 2 adult and 1 children, but then my other 2 child also go with us. I am little bit afraid if they don't have room that can accommodate us. All my children below 12, so I cannot let them stay in separate room. When check-in as AAP member, we request and inform our problem and the staff is help us to upgrade to deluxe room which is usually enough for 2 adult and 2 children to accommodate us. And what is nice to us is after 7 hours flight you would like to enter your room immediately and thanks to the friendly staff that help us to check-in early since there is a room ready for us. You could imagine us, two adults with 3 children below 12 years old (5, 8, 9 years) in a room perhaps 25m2. Its little but enough for us, and we are happy with the room. Very clean, nice, free wifi, even they have iPod dock in room and other in-room facilities as Mercure Class Hotel. Our children also happy and feels at home.Now the story that never expected began in family holidays. After taking rest I realize that my younger kid start to get fever in the afternoon, perhaps due to cold in winter. We then give him paracetamol medicine to reduce his fever but its not happen, and suddenly after high fever for 3 hours in the night, He start seizure (first time in his life) and immediately I call front desk to call an ambulance. In this story, I would like to thanks so much to Ms. Fukushima-san who immediately call an ambulance and in few minutes Ms. Fukushima-san and paramedic entering our room and help my son. As a Hotel staff her english is very good and she translate all our conversation between paramedic and us. Then we go to hospital with paramedic and get some medical help from International Hospital near the hotel. Once again this hotel is very recommended for family with children to stay. One more good things is breakfast is free for all of your children. In other hotel they will ask you to pay half price for breakfast for children, but in this hotel not. Definitely we will stay again in this "home" in near future.

Stayed in December, arrived 5 hours early, they found us a room that was ready. Very friendly staff. Twin room was big, clean and a good standard. Great location in a quiet shopping part of the city. I really would recommend this hotel and will stay again next time I'm in Tokyo!

This hotel is a little gem. It wasn't too expensive, given we were in Tokyo, with our Accor vouchers. There was a subway station which could be accessed from the hotel lifts, which was super convenient. Right in a major shopping area, with easy access to transport, close to the Imperial Palace and Tsujiki fish markets as well.

We are a young couple travelling in Japan.The location of the hotel was fantastic. It is a very short stroll from the main shopping streets in Ginza - they are simply amazing. The Imperial Palace/Gardens and Kabuka Theatre are walking distance as well. There is a metro station that can be accessed directly below the hotel and two other metro stations a short walk away which allows easy and direct access to most things in Tokyo (including the airport). Purchasing Pasmo cards to use the metro subway and JR Rail systems was one of the best bits of advice we received upon arriving in Tokyo. There are some great little cafes and restaurants in the surrounding streets as well as two Family Marts (small supermarkets) where you can get anything you may want to buy. We were incredibly pleased with the location and it allowed us to explore and enjoy so much of Tokyo during the 6 days we were there.We stayed on the 8th floor. It was perfectly quiet, which was a pleasant surprise for such a busy area. The room was a good size (by Tokyo standards) (make sure you're expecting small by western standards when you visit Japan).The big down side for us was the cleanliness of the room. The carpet in the room was very old and incredibly stained and dirty. The bathroom was also dirty in some spots. When we opened one of the bedside drawers, we found some pornographic cards, condoms and lubricant - presumably from a previous guest. Aside from the state in which we found the room, the hotel is comfortable and represents good value. Hopefully this aspect can be improved by the hotel to ensure an entirely enjoyable stay for future guests.

Stayed here for 3 nights during Christmas. The hotel is on top of one metro station and a very short walk to two others (including Higashi-Ginza which has express rail services to Haneda and Narita). Extremely good location within Ginza.The room (single) was clean, comfortable and larger than I had expected; it's still small, but there are much worse out there.Staff were helpful and friendly.

Stayed a week in a twin room at this Accor chain hotel for a conference. The rate was moderate. Prices for laundry—I use the hotel laundry every day—were reasonable. But the room was small and practically only good for single occupancy. I slept in one bed and laid my suitcase open on the other. You are trading space to save money.It's a short taxi ride to/from the hotel to Tokyo Station and the Narita Express train to/from the airport. In the midst of shopping/food being in Ginza. Also a short stroll or one Metro stop from luxury shopping/food and offices in Marunouchi. The Ginza 1-chome Metro station has an entrance/exit in the hotel basement. Restaurant tends to French/Mediterranean offerings. The waiters in the restaurant scrupulously serve you only from your right side. L'Occitane toiletries.

The location is great however, we would not stay here again. This was the most expensive hotel we stayed at while in Japan and it was the smallest. We didn't even have enough room to layout out carryon suitcases!! If you want to stay in Ginza then I would definitely choose another hotel, I'm sure that, for the price, you can do much better. We found Tokyo to be extremely safe and the transportation is fantastic so find the cheapest hotel and do more sightseeing, shopping and eating!!!

- Room: Size is Okay for Tokyo standard- Location: Great but I prefer other areas next time.- Metro: Under the building and another one not far- Restaurant: Not impressive. Food quality is not good. Variety of food is limited. Dinner is practically leftover from lunch but more expensive. Also some confusions at the restaurant because one of the server didn't understand about Accor voucher at all-it was upsetting to have to explain again and again.- Reception: Nice.- The cleaning lady: very nice.

We stayed a week at this hotel in early December. It was perfect for our needs as first-time visitors to Tokyo.The location is superb — within easy walking distance to the Ginza subway stop. It is also just a short walk to two big department stores (Mitsuya Ginza and Mitsokoshi) which have great food halls and many restaurants. Just across the street from the hotel is a very good restaurant, Shosho-an, which specializes in soba but also has many other items on the menu.The Mercure rooms are very comfortable and are kept spotlessly clean.The staff tries to be helpful, but there are some limitations to their ability to help when the guest is an English speaker.This deficiency was totally overcome by one of the most helpful hotel employees we have ever encountered, an assistant manager named Javier Piqueros, a native of Spain who has worked for the Accor chain for several years.He was able to help us with any questions we had and provided much useful information. He was always willing to go to any lengths to assist us. He works hard to assure that guests maximize their experience in Tokyo, even going so far as to print out sheets suggesting local events that might be of interest.We would definitely stay here again if we were fortunate enough to return to Tokyo.

Great hotel. Was offered an upgrade to ladies room. The amenities in the room where perfectly suited for womens' need. The amenities pack provide hair ties, hair clips, moisturizer, lotion, essences.The location of the hotel is superior, 5mins walking distance to all the big brands in Ginza (Mitsukoshi, LV, Burberry, Chanel, Mikimoto). 10-15mins walk away from O1O1, LOFT and Tsukiji. Lastly, must apprise the staffs. I left my mobile phone when I checked out the hotel, but the staffs were kind enough to help me rapidly locate my phone and waited in the lobby for me to pick it up, so I won't miss my bus (I was in a rush to go to the airport). A hotel to recommend and return to for my next visit

Just retuned from 4 nights at the Mecure Tokyo Ginza, stayed in 2 rooms with my family of 5. One Superior Queen and 1 Twin deluxe room. The twin deluxe has lots more space and would recommend this. Great hotel in excellent location 10 min walk to the JR line or 10- 15 min walk to Tokyo Central and Tokyo Station. Hotel was very clean and the staff were extremely courteous and very helpful with all our needs. The breakfast was excellent as was the dinner. I would recommend this ecxellent hotel.

Hotel was nice - good location, simple but nice breakfast options, and comfortable rooms. Many local good outlets for eating outside the hotel if needed. Disappointing there is no on-site gym, however an off-site gym is available for guests at a cost. Overall it was clean, tidy, and reasonably priced. I would stay again. Thanks.

Location in Ginza nearby all the branded shopping area.Uniglo and Tsukiji market are places you can walk to.Room is standard Japan style small with limited space.Service was good. I arrived 9am thinking I have to wander around but they actually found me a room to check in to rest after my overnight flight.Breakfast did not try.Entrance is not prominent at all. You will miss it if you don't look carefully.

Awesome location. Comfortable room size and convenient location that I can almost get anything. Getting to asasuka is only 2 station away, great shopping just 5 min walk from hotel. I will stay there again.

The ease of access to this hotel is amazing. Its 1 minutes by foot to the Tokyo Train station, 5 minutes to Ginza subway station and if you are getting to Tokyo by bus from the Narita airport then the Ginza stop is 10 minutes away. The location has hundreds of restaurants, depending on what you are craving the hotel staff will hand you a map and advise you of some good places to eat!The area is great to shop and explorer. You can walk about 20 minutes to the Tokyo Fish Market for some great fresh sushi.Apart the helpful staff, great location you get complementary free WiFi in the room, tea and coffee. The room for a Ginza location hotel is just about right. With my wife and 2 big suitcases we managed to move around and the bathroom was quiet comfortable as well.So if you are in Tokyo for business, fun, shopping or sightseeing this is a great value and location. Will be coming back soon!

We stayed 2. Nights(end Nov)in this hotel after staying at Shiodome area. Our family of four like this place as it is easily accessible than the previous hotel. The european staff( forgot his name)is well-versed in English, and he is very friendly and provided us a lot of information about the place and restaurant recommendations.We were upgraded to deluxe room, the room was very spacious and able to accommodate 4 pax in room. Room was clean but the TV size was too small.The walking distance to the Ginza private bus stop is about 8 mins. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to family travelers.

Actually I stayed here on May 2013. The hotel is right on the Ginza district. Therefore, the hotel location is very good. There are two metro station nearby; one is Higashiginza (around 400 m walking) and I forgot the name of another one.We booked the deluxe room and it is perfectly fit for three of us. There's bidet on the bathroom so don't worry if you are bidet lovers. The hotel staffs are great and helpful. Their English level is also very good. However, having just arrived from Mercure Sapporo where the wifi was very excellent, but the wifi in Mercure Tokyo is huge disappointment. The speed was very slow and the signal often get lost if we use it on bed, but since we were already tired so we didn't ask to the reception.Another one, I was not allowed to enter the restaurant since I was wearing sandal. It's okay for me since I knew that some of the hotels have strict policy regarding this and the floors might be slippery for those who wear sandal therefore I return to the room and changed to my shoes. However, I was so upset when I sat down on the restaurant and found out a Caucasian man wearing hotel slippers while enjoying his breakfast so the breakfast taste bit bitter for me on that time.Despite the slow wifi and that incident, probably I would stay here again if I comeback to Tokyo since there are limited options for Accor members in Tokyo area.

Great location! Stores are just within walking distance! And so is the metro (ginza line), so it's easy to go to shinjuku and other cities. The tokyo station which is 8 to 10 minute walk, you can go to farther places like Mt Fuji! A lot of authentic Japanese restaurants around and you love it if you like their food! The rooms are small but cozy. The staffs are very helpful! The breakfast is great if it's part of your reservation. I have been in this hotel more than once and I would recommend this hotel!

GREAT Location (Heart of Ginza, nearby subway Station!) and GREAT Staff! Please refer to Mr.Sasaki (Manager) for anything You might need! Kindness and availabilty is His motto!Nice French Hotel Restaurant inside of the Hotel...GOOD when too tired...!

Located in the very central Ginza District, this hotel offers a good price-quality ratio... The rooms are small (but this is Tokyo!) but very clean and calm. The staff was also very kind and polite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to spend a couple of days in the center of Tokyo.

Tucked down a quiet side road right in the centre of the shopping district and if your feeling fit only 30 mins walk from the Palace, very helpful well mannered staff. Rooms as you would expect from a Mecure hotel. The Hotel is also well located near a few Metro stops and a mainline station.

I love the location: I usually walk from Tokyo station when I come with the airport bus, from either Narita or Haneda. About 20' walk but it's feasible.Otherwise there is a subway line right under the hotel.The service is attentive and professional.I have never tried the breakfast because the "traffic light" signs in the elevator put me off with what time to go for less queue...so I always walk to Starbucks, which is less than 2 minutes away.I stayed in this hotel more than 4 times now in the past years and never found the same level of spotless rooms compared to other hotels. I do yoga in the morning (which is quite a challenge because the room is small...) and noticed that the carpet could be much cleaner. And some walls could need fresh paint to hide marks of suitcase or what not.I wish I could open the windows to get some fresh air, as I noticed that the air in the hall is cleaner and fresher than the one in the room.This hotel is a good value for money, and especially for this location.

We arrived at the hotel after a long flight (longer than it should have been) and after having been messed around by our airline with one of our bags missing. It was easy to get there, we took the Narita Express to Tokyo station and then treated ourselves to a taxi (we were pretty exhausted) which cost only 700 yen. On entering the reception we were served straight away and as soon as we had said who we were the girl checking us in immediately said that she had heard we were missing a bag and that she was sorry (the airline had contacted the hotel before we even arrived there). We were surprised by this and it was a nice touch and it set the bar then for the rest of our stay. The check in process was quick and easy, the staff very polite and friendly. We were told that when the bag arrived at the hotel they would deliver it to our room so it would be there when we came back from our first day of sightseeing, fantastic service!!The room wasn't huge but it also wasn't small, it was clean and the bed was comfortable, we also had a desk with chair and an armchair with footstool. There was a fridge with minibar but it was also possible for us to use it for our own food/drink, we had a tv and a safe and tea/coffee facilities with coffee cups, tea cups and there were also plenty of glasses for us to use. Everything we needed!The bathroom was clean with a shower over the bath, the bath wasn't massive but hey we were in Japan. We were supplied with shampoo, conditioner, bath/shower gel, razor, toothbrushes and paste, hairbrush, shower cap and the list goes on. When we travel we are the type of people that when we leave the hotel in the morning we are out all day sightseeing and don't return until the evening so this hotel was perfect for us, the location was great as it was conveniently located near 3 different subway stations, in a fantastic shopping area and if you're interested in seeing the Tsukiji Fish market it is only a 15min walk away (really a must see!) We're not high maintenance travellers so not really demanding of the hotel staff but the contact that we had with them they couldn't have been more helpful, friendly or polite. We would definitely stay here again!

Rooms not so new and not so old. Not extremely clean also not dirty. Location is very very good. You are in the middle of Ginza (one of the best shopping districts of Tokyo) and only 10min walking to Yurakucho station (on Yamanote line). There is everything you might need near the hotel. The only problem is that you can't open the windows in this hotel. So there is never fresh air. They said it was a rule in Tokyo but we could open the windows at the hotel that we stayed later in Tokyo…. So if you are a person who needs fresh air in the room do not stay here. If this is not a problem for you then stay here but don't have high expectations (for me it wasn't a problem but for my partner it was a big problem, as he always opens windows of bedroom before he sleeps) Overall it was enough for me because of location but i guess next time we are in Tokyo we would stay somewhere else.

This hotel is right in the middle of Ginza, which is a great place to stay in Tokyo because of its high end shops and good restaurants. Room was large, with two double beds, desk, minibar, closet and coffee machine. Decor is a little dated, but the room and clean and comfortable.Staff was great. Very polite and extremely helpful. Also, they speak English very well and can recommend lots of nearby places, such as shops and restaurants, and give you directions to everything else in Tokyo.Bathroom is good, with the shower head inside a bathtub and shower curtain. They provide all basic toiletries, including toothbrush.

This is an amazing place to stay if you're traveling alone or with a few people in Tokyo. It's right in the heart of Ginza, and has easy access to trains and walking distance to awesome Ginza hot spots. If you are on a business trip or with a group of more than 10 people, this is NOT for you. Any vehicle larger than a small taxi cannot get down the street in front of the hotel, so you will be walking a few blocks from your bus or van. The rooms are great. Awesome décor. Perfect chic hotel with a great French restaurant in the lobby, which is on the 2nd floor.

I must commend the hotel for having such a great location, its directly connected to the subway station exit! And situated in the heart of Ginza, this hotel is definitely recommended for avid shoppers!There is a convenience store just across the road and a macdonalds on the first floor if you're looking for a bite. Its a short walk to the main street in Ginza (Apple Store, LV, Abercrombie and Fitch...)The room is small, bed is comfortable but i just have to comment that the sleeping attire and towels were left underneath the sink, beside the toilet bowl, which to me doesn't seem hygienic! But the house keeping did a great job in cleaning up the toilet anyway, and i've used their towels and sleep wear!If you are travelling to Narita next, the hotel do sell the airport bus tickets so do consider purchasing before you leave the property. The (TCAT) bus terminal is just a short cab ride away.

It is situated at a prime location that is right where Ginza shopping streets are located. The ramen restaurant just round the corner opens till late so I was able to get supper late at night upon arrival from the airport. 15-20 minutes walk to the main subway/train station that connects to most lines. Walked all the way to Tsukiji fish market too (40 minutes maybe?), while enjoying the sights and shops along the way. Amenities are decent, wished there was a gym though. Good size rooms for Tokyo standards. Breakfast was decent, standard international breakfast with good enough selections. I would definitely stay again. This hotel is part of the Accorhotels group of companies, which is great for members.

Stayed for 1 night between arriving in Tokyo & catching the bullet train to Kyoto. The hotel was very conveniently located (10-15 min walk) from Tokyo Station. The room was relatively big for Tokyo & our room had great amenties. Would stay again

Great location. Walking distance to Yurakucho station. Love the proximity of the department stores.Very cozy room at 22 sqm. Once you put everything in its place it's roomy enough to move around in. Bathroom great size and doesn't make you feel like you're using a matchbox of a toilet.We got the 22 sqm room because we need a connecting room. I wish they have bigger rooms for connecting rooms. Bed comfy. Linens so soft and don't make too much noise when you shift either. Staff very courteous and helpful.Free wifi too. Didn't eat in the hotel as we wake up after breakfast service.McDonald's downstairs. There's a Lawson's convenience store, Starbucks (turn right when you exit the hotel) & Family mart (turn left when exiting the hotel).Great tempura place beside lawson's. Amazing Basement 1 restaurant named Em after starbucks in the Ginza Omi building. Do eat here. Great food and the decor is just amazing!Will definitely stay here again!

second visit to this hotel which was disappointing. the restaurant was closed Saturday and Sunday evening for a function. then when I return for the 3rd time again same thing. just a note on the bed in the room saying we apologize. after 10 hours flight. you don't always want to walk the street in search of somewhere to eat. I had book thinking a quick bite after a long flight and in bed.... not the case. another night, there was only one option for dinner: Couscous for 6000 yen. not everyone wants to eat couscous and not everyone wants to pay that kind of money for a bite...

This was perfect for location, shopping, dining, and sightseeing. Helpful staff, good size room, big bathroom, comfortable beds, very clean. Best of all, quite reasonable in price. It is about 5 blocks from main Tokyo train station and next to the subway. Easily walked with luggage (and we're in late 60's). It is right off Ginza, with all the popular shops within a few blocks. Fish market about 10-15 minute walk. Although some of the dining can be quite expensive, lots of tiny places along the streets or down stairs were wonderful fines and very reasonable. Even a McDonalds almost next door. Would highly recommend and would definitely stay there again. Another train station is 4 blocks away for connections to every station or subway. Both Tokoy main station and the other are great for eating or shopping also.

The hotel is as expected of a chain hotel. The rooms are clean and functional and a tat bigger than most same class hotel. Location is ok if you like glitzy surroundings as it is couple mins walk from the Ginza main street. Subway wise, covered by ginza, hibiya, asakusa and yurakucho lines that will lead you to almost every part of tokyo. We really appreciate the service hotel provided us to allow us to deposit our excess luggage prior to check in date. we do not want to lug all pieces on our way to Osaka and then back to tokyo.if you have many land heavy uggages, and coming from the Main Tokyo station, take the Yurakucho Line and stop at Ginza-Itchome station, the hotel is just round the corner. From Airport take the Asakusa line stop at Higashi-ginza station, Exit 1. there is elevator in that exit.

MERCURE GINZA HOTELIf staying in Tokyo and you require central, comfortable accommodation, we can highly recommend the Mercure Ginza. Not modern, but very well maintained and offers excellent stays. Our room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and well serviced during our stay. Coffee and tea making facilities (larger cups would be a plus), and the breakfast more than ample with a large selection to suit all tastes. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the major shopping precinct, the fish markets, Tokyo station where you can buy a Suica card (a must!) and a good JR rail and subway route maps to get you exploring this delightful city. PS: Check “The Backstreet Guides” site. A great tour company.

This is a fantastically well-located hotel right smack in the middle of Ginza, literally on top of a subway station (and thanks to that, you will pay what most Americans consider luxury-hotel prices for a mid-range but very nice hotel. Welcome to Tokyo). It's a bit tricky to find - the main entrance is a small side door on a small side street, but there's signage at the end of the block. When in doubt, just say "Mercure" to a taxi driver in your very best French accent.Service is great. Rooms are small but clean, extremely quiet, comfortable and well-furnished. Only one English-language channel on the TV, hope you like BBC World News. The restaurant/bar isn't much but why would you eat there anyway when you have all of Ginza at your disposal?NB: They have a policy whereby you have to actually pay your bill anytime it gets up to about 100K yen (or 1,000 USD, which will come sooner than you think if you're staying more than a few days).Overall would definitely recommend it either for business or personal travel. It's a good value for Ginza, which I think is the most expensive neighborhood in Tokyo.

Stayed there last year for 6 nights. We took two rooms connected each other as we travelled with two kids.The location is superb, very close to the famous Ginza shopping street. And this hotel has direct access to Ginza subway station, very useful during rainy days.Both rooms are very clean, well maintained, and the beds are very comfy since they use "simmons bed".Two mini stores are located just outside the building, as well as 24 hr McD.Overall it's a good hotel to stay when visiting Tokyo

We stayed for 5 night.Lobby hotel in 2nd floor.what the best from this hotel is: This hotel have great access from lift to ginza icchome subway station. And U won't never get hungry as mcd is beside the hotel and it opens 24 hours.lawson starbucks matsuya shopping mall and local restaurant is really near from the hotel.the staff is so kind,they gave us a bottle of wine as complementary for our honeymoon and we got free upgrade room. Their english speaking is good. Room was clean and the bed was comfort.Service is excellent. I will definitely come back to this hotel for my next trip to tokyo

We stayed at the Mercure Ginza for 7 days before moving onto Osaka and then back for 1 more night. The hotel is in a great location, Ginza shopping area is on your doorstep and the subway stations and Tokyo mainline station are within walking distance. It was also nice walking around Ginza at night, with the lights and wide clean streets, it's a more upmarket area of Tokyo a bit like 5th Ave/Bond Street/Champs Elysees. The hotel itself was ok, not as modern as others we've been in but not dreadfully old fashioned. We had a Queen Deluxe room which was an ok size. Breakfast was ok, not the most inspiring but good to have on the go. The staff were great, very helpful and informative. Especially Javier who gave us really helpful tips and information when we arrived. Any questions about the area and Tokyo the staff were able to answer and they had helpful leaflets of restaurants in the area and the fish market opening hours.

The Mercure is poor. Its superior rooms are not well styled. You cannot change lights except by withdrawing the door key. Two lifts fail to serve the floor where both reception and the restaurant are. English is very poor, better from the waiters. The bedroom windows face a blank wall across a narrow road. The food is mediocre. Altogether disappointingly poor .

Clseo to ginza shops and Tokyo station: about a 5 minute cab ride. Easier than walking although doable.Correct size for Tokyo Helpful staffRooms were quiet.Did not try restaurant as there are many options in ginza.

Mercure GinzaWe stayed in a double room for two nights. What we liked:The hotel is well-located in Ginza and convenient for Tokyo Station, the Imperial Palace and shopping in Ginza. For a hotel right in the heart of things, it was affordable. Helpful staffThe room was clean and comfortable, perhaps a bit on the ‘cosy’ side, with a reasonable array of amenities Things that weren’t as great:Our room (on one of the lower floors) faced an office building so we had to keep the curtains closed all the time so we didn’t feel like we were on display. OverallThe Mercure benefits from a great location and affordable rates.

Stayed in Mercure Ginza from Oct 4 to 7 and had a wonderful stay. Even before we arrived, we got in touch with the hotel to assist us in reservations for a restaurant which they did perfectly and we really appreciated that. Staff were friendly and we were able to check in earlier than usual. Staff also speak good English and provided us with information and directions to nearby places. We took the superior twin room (2 single beds); room was clean and of bigger size than other hotels I've stayed in Japan. Also very generous with toiletries e.g. razor, toothbrush, hairbrush, cotton pads etc. Only comment I have is that the single bed I had was slightly "sunken" in, most likely due to the wear and tear of the spring. The location of the hotel is very central, 5 mins walk to the main Ginza shopping area where you can find almost everything, including the largest Uniqlo and department stores e.g. matsuya, mitsukoshi, which have designer and local brands. You can also buy local and international food from their depachikas (basement supermarkets). Down the road from the hotel (approx. 1 min or less), you'll find McDonalds (i think it's 24 hours) and Lawson convenience store. We also spotted several italian/ french/ ramen restaurants/ starbucks around the area, all within walking distance. The hotel is also easily accessible by several Metro (subway) lines as you can walk to the Ginza/ Ginza Itchome/ Yurakucho stations. We also managed to walk back from the popular Tsukiji market (about 15 to 20 mins) on Monday morning through the typhoon!All in all, a pleasant stay, easily accessible and very convenient location in Tokyo! Thank you.

We spent 10 nights here and would definitely recommend this hotel - we intend to return there in 2015. We found the staff to be friendly and obliging, in particular the dining room staff - as well as providing excellent service; they assisted us with information, directions and recommendations each day. The rooms are clean and a generous size for Tokyo. We had the breakfast buffet every morning - a small but very good selection. We also dined in the restaurant - excellent meals and service - recommend the daily special options.Several subway stations are a short walk away so we found getting around Tokyo from here was a breeze. The large department stores nearby have basement food halls providing a wide and wonderful selection - they have entrances from the subway and if you go there near closing, they mark down a lot of the food. For something on the go, amongst other options, there is a Starbucks, McDonalds, Doutor Cafe (nice rolls etc) and a Lawson convenience store close by.

Do not hesitate to stay at Mercure Tokyo Ginza. My wife and I stayed on Sept. 7-18th.Excellent customer service, no exception.Special thanks to Ms. Kunigi (front desk) and Mr. Murata (former sales manager). At this time, he is at Ibis styles in Kyoto). Both are so atencious, polite.Good breakfast and dinner.Service is good as well. Its localization is pretty close of shops, restaurants, metro and trains.All is perfect!Thanks, Kunigi-sama, Murata-sama and all Mercure Ginza staff for attention.Domo arigato gozaimashita!

Nice room and nice location, right in the middle of the Ginza district. Lots of nice eating places nearby, though a little pricey.I didn't use the restaurant; I was told my room rate hadn't included breakfast, and looking at the price, it was far cheaper to buy something from the Lawson's shop at the end of the block, just a few yards away.There is a 24/7 Biggu Makku, next door, but there are far nicer places to eat!The bathroom was pleasant and the shower gel has a very pleasant smell.Would I stay there again? YES !!Arigato gozaimasu.
user_name:
Tim S
East Grinstead, United Kingdom

review_body: We are staying in this place for 4 nights and 2 more nights to go.Don't expect anything although they act like they are a high class hotel.Some good thing is a spacious room, though nothing special in it, typical Mercure nothingness. The location, in the midst of Ginza district, is convenient for (overpriced) shopping and (must visit) Kabuki.And now, a couple of bad things that overrule the above mentioned.1.
